title = Dr. Cabbie 
overview = An unemployed doctor turned cab driver becomes a local hero when he converts his taxi into a mobile clinic. Dr. CABBIE is the heart warming journey of a young Indian Doctor who immigrates to Canada with the selfless ambition of healing others while beginning a new life in the land of opportunity. Dr. CABBIE discovers his true purpose and true love when he embarks upon this journey of a doctor turned cabbie. 
production compagnie = Caramel Film 
Producer = Pauline Dhillon 
revenue = 0.2 millions of dollars 
Director = Jean-François Pouliot 
average note = 5.7 
budget = 293.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
cast = Vinay Virmani, Kunal Nayyar, Isabelle Kaif, Adrianne Palicki 
tagline = Pay your doctor... by the meter... 
date of release = the 19 of September 2014 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct.the production company mentioned in the description is indeed caramel film.']
fact : production compagnie = Caramel Film 

In the heartwarming film "Dr. Cabbie," directed by Jean-François Pouliot and produced by Pauline Dhillon under Caramel Film, we follow the journey of a young Indian doctor who transforms his taxi into a mobile clinic, becoming a local hero in the process. Immigrating to Canada with the noble intention of healing others, our protagonist discovers his true purpose and love while navigating his dual roles as a doctor and a cabbie. Starring Vinay Virmani, Kunal Nayyar, Isabelle Kaif, and Adrianne Palicki, this uplifting tale is underscored by the tagline "Pay your doctor... by the meter." Despite its modest revenue of 0.2 million dollars against a budget of 293 million dollars, the film resonated with audiences, earning an average rating of 5.7. With a runtime of 1 hour and 41 minutes, "Dr. Cabbie" was released on the 19th of September 2014, captivating viewers with its inspiring narrative and memorable performances.

duration of the movie = 1h23

production compagnie = Universal International Pictures (UI) 
average note = 7.4 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Charles Barton 
cast = Bud Abbott, Lou Costello, Lon Chaney Jr., Bela Lugosi 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 15 of June 1948 
Producer = Robert Arthur 
revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact mentioned is that the duration of the movie is 1h23 (or 1 hour and 23 minutes), which matches the description. therefore, my answer is: **correct**']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h23 

In "Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein," directed by Charles Barton, two hapless freight handlers, played by Bud Abbott and Lou Costello, find themselves in a series of comedic encounters with classic monsters such as Dracula (Bela Lugosi), the Frankenstein Monster, and the Wolf Man (Lon Chaney Jr.). This classic film, produced by Universal International Pictures (UI) and released on the 15th of June 1948 in the United States of America, has an average rating of 7.4. With a budget of 108.6 million dollars, the movie, produced by Robert Arthur, went on to generate a revenue of 130.5 million dollars. The film runs for 1 hour and 23 minutes and is presented in its original English language.

fact : production compagnie = Universal International Pictures (UI) 

In "Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein," directed by Charles Barton, two hapless freight handlers, played by Bud Abbott and Lou Costello, find themselves in a series of comedic encounters with classic monsters such as Dracula (Bela Lugosi), the Frankenstein Monster, and the Wolf Man (Lon Chaney Jr.). This classic film, produced by Universal International Pictures (UI) and released on the 15th of June 1948 in the United States of America, has an average rating of 7.4. With a budget of 108.6 million dollars, the movie, produced by Robert Arthur, went on to generate a revenue of 130.5 million dollars. The film runs for 1 hour and 23 minutes and is presented in its original English language.

title = Blow 
overview = A boy named George Jung grows up in a struggling family in the 1950's. His mother nags at her husband as he is trying to make a living for the family. It is finally revealed that George's father cannot make a living and the family goes bankrupt. George does not want the same thing to happen to him, and his friend Tuna, in the 1960's, suggests that he deal marijuana. He is a big hit in California in the 1960's, yet he goes to jail, where he finds out about the wonders of cocaine. As a result, when released, he gets rich by bringing cocaine to America. However, he soon pays the price. 
cast = Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, Ray Liotta 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
Producer = Denis Leary 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
tagline = Based on a True Story. 
date of release = the 4 of April 2001 
revenue = 83.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 7.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: correct.according to the description, the cast includes johnny depp, penélope cruz, ethan suplee, and ray liotta. this matches the provided fact about the cast.']
fact : cast = Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, Ray Liotta 

In the riveting film "Blow," based on a true story, we follow the journey of George Jung, portrayed by the talented Johnny Depp. Growing up in the 1950s in a struggling family, George is determined to avoid the same financial hardships his family faced. With the help of his friend Tuna, he enters the world of marijuana dealing in the 1960s, eventually becoming a major player in California. However, his success takes a dark turn when he discovers the lucrative trade of cocaine while in jail. Upon his release, George becomes wealthy by smuggling cocaine into America, but his newfound riches come at a steep price. The stellar cast includes Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, and Ray Liotta, delivering powerful performances that bring this gripping tale to life. Directed by Denis Leary and produced by New Line Cinema, "Blow" is a compelling exploration of the rise and fall of a notorious figure in the drug trade. Released on April 4, 2001, in the United States, the film garnered $83.3 million in revenue and received an average rating of 7.4. Don't miss this intense and captivating portrayal of one man's journey into the dangerous world of drug trafficking.

Upon his release, George becomes wealthy by smuggling cocaine into America, but his newfound riches come at a steep price. The stellar cast includes Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, and Ray Liotta, delivering powerful performances that bring this gripping tale to life. Directed by Denis Leary and produced by New Line Cinema, "Blow" is a compelling exploration of the rise and fall of a notorious figure in the drug trade. Released on April 4, 2001, in the United States, the film garnered $83.3 million in revenue and received an average rating of 7.4. Don't miss this intense and captivating portrayal of one man's journey into the dangerous world of drug trafficking. 
 
 

 
title = Citizen Kane 
overview = Newspaper magnate, Charles Foster Kane is taken from his mother as a boy and made the ward of a rich industrialist. As a result, every well-meaning, tyrannical or self-destructive move he makes for the rest of his life appears in some way to be a reaction to that deeply wounding event.

revenue = 23.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures

production countrie = United States of America

In "Citizen Kane," produced by Orson Welles, we delve into the life of newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane. From being taken from his mother as a boy and raised by a wealthy industrialist, Kane's every action seems to stem from this pivotal event. The film, with a duration of 1 hour and 59 minutes, was produced by RKO Radio Pictures and made a revenue of 23.2 million dollars. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, "Citizen Kane" is a timeless classic that explores the complexities of power, wealth, and the impact of one's past.

title = Westworld 
overview = In a futuristic resort, wealthy patrons can visit recreations of different time periods and experience their wildest fantasies with life-like robots. But when Richard Benjamin opts for the wild west, he gets more than he bargained for when a gunslinger robot goes berserk. 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
revenue = 197.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Yul Brynner, Richard Benjamin, James Brolin, Norman Bartold 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
tagline = Westworld ...where robot men and women are programmed to serve you for ...Romance ...Violence ...Anything 
Producer = Paul Lazarus III 
average note = 6.7 
Director = Michael Crichton 
date of release = the 22 of October 1973 
budget = 8.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the production company is indeed metro-goldwyn-mayer (mgm).']
fact : production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 

In the 1973 film "Westworld," directed by Michael Crichton and produced by Paul Lazarus III, viewers are transported to a futuristic resort where wealthy patrons can live out their fantasies with life-like robots. Starring Yul Brynner, Richard Benjamin, James Brolin, and Norman Bartold, the movie follows Richard Benjamin's character as he chooses to experience the wild west, only to encounter a malfunctioning gunslinger robot. With a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, "Westworld" was produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) and grossed $197.6 million at the box office. The film, with a budget of $8.8 million, was released on October 22, 1973, and received an average rating of 6.7. The tagline "Westworld ...where robot men and women are programmed to serve you for ...Romance ...Violence ...Anything" sets the tone for this thrilling sci-fi adventure.

title = Seven Dead in the Cat's Eye 
overview = In a small Scottish village, horribly murdered bodies keep turning up. Suspicion falls upon the residents of a nearby castle that is haunted by a curse involving a killer cat. 
cast = Jane Birkin, Hiram Keller, Françoise Christophe, Venantino Venantini 
date of release = the 12 of April 1973 
Director = Antonio Margheriti 
average note = 6.4 
budget = 38.9 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Roxy Films 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact that "seven dead in the cat\'s eye" has a cast including jane birkin, hiram keller, françoise christophe, and venantino venantini is mentioned in the description.']
fact : cast = Jane Birkin, Hiram Keller, Françoise Christophe, Venantino Venantini 

In the eerie Scottish village where the chilling mystery unfolds, "Seven Dead in the Cat's Eye" takes viewers on a suspenseful journey as gruesomely murdered bodies continue to surface. The haunting tale centers around a nearby castle plagued by a deadly curse linked to a malevolent feline. With a stellar cast including Jane Birkin, Hiram Keller, Françoise Christophe, and Venantino Venantini, the film, directed by the talented Antonio Margheriti, captivates audiences with its atmospheric setting and spine-tingling plot. Released on the 12th of April 1973 by Roxy Films, this intriguing thriller, with an average rating of 6.4, weaves a web of fear and suspicion, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. With a budget of 38.9 million dollars, this cinematic masterpiece delivers a truly unforgettable and hair-raising experience.

Released on the 12th of April 1973 by Roxy Films, this intriguing thriller, with an average rating of 6.4, weaves a web of fear and suspicion, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. With a budget of 38.9 million dollars, this cinematic masterpiece delivers a truly unforgettable and hair-raising experience.

title = Sting of the Black Scorpion 
overview = Cop by day, masked crusader by night, the fearless and sultry Black Scorpion must protect the City of Angels from a deadly trio of villains... the prosthetic machine gun Firearm, the time-controlling Clockwise, and vision-stealing Flashpoint. 
Director = Stanley Yung 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Craig J. Nevius 
budget = 268.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 279.7 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 6 of November 2002 
cast = Michelle Lintel, Scott Valentine, Frank Gorshin, Martin Kove 
production compagnie = New Concorde 

TP  -  TruePositive
['**correct!**the description states: "director = stanley yung", which is indeed correct.']
fact : Director = Stanley Yung 

In the action-packed movie "Sting of the Black Scorpion," directed by Stanley Yung, viewers are taken on a thrilling ride through the City of Angels. By day, a dedicated cop protects the city, but by night, the fearless and seductive Black Scorpion emerges as a masked crusader. When a deadly trio of villains threatens the peace - including the prosthetic machine gun-wielding Firearm, the time-controlling Clockwise, and the vision-stealing Flashpoint - Black Scorpion must rise to the challenge. Starring Michelle Lintel, Scott Valentine, Frank Gorshin, and Martin Kove, this English-language film was produced by Craig J. Nevius with a whopping budget of 268.3 million dollars. Released on November 6, 2002, in the United States of America, the movie went on to generate a revenue of 279.7 million dollars for the production company New Concorde.

title = Stranger in Our House 
overview = A country family of five takes in cousin Julia, whose parents recently perished in a car crash. Julia extends her influence over the family and those around them, fooling all except for Rachel, the teenaged girl who knows her cousin is up to no good.  This TV horror movie had the title "Stranger in Our House" when it was originally released by NBC on Halloween night in 1978. When released on VHS in the late 1980s, the title was changed to "Summer of Fear", which is the title of the Lois Duncan book on which it is based. 
budget = 163.8 millions of dollars 
revenue = 114.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Tonight, the world premiere of a chilling story of witchcraft, demons and the supernatural! 
production compagnie = Finnegan Associates 
Director = Wes Craven 

TP  -  TruePositive
['i found the fact: [budget = 163.8 millions of dollars]so, my answer is: correct']
fact : budget = 163.8 millions of dollars 

In the TV horror movie "Stranger in Our House", a country family of five opens their home to their cousin Julia, who manipulates and deceives everyone except for Rachel, a teenage girl who sees through her cousin's sinister intentions. Directed by Wes Craven and released by NBC on Halloween night in 1978, this chilling tale of witchcraft and the supernatural originally carried the title "Stranger in Our House". However, when it was later released on VHS in the late 1980s, the title was changed to "Summer of Fear", aligning with the Lois Duncan book on which it is based. With a budget of 163.8 million dollars and a revenue of 114.3 million dollars, this 1 hour and 40-minute film takes viewers on a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. As the family grapples with Julia's mysterious influence, the tagline teases the audience with the promise of a world premiere that delves into the realms of demons and dark forces. Set in the United States of America and produced by Finnegan Associates, "Stranger in Our House" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

Set in the United States of America and produced by Finnegan Associates, "Stranger in Our House" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

['i found the fact: the date of release is indeed october 31st, 1978.']
fact : date of release = the 31 of October 1978 

In the TV horror movie "Stranger in Our House", a country family of five opens their home to their cousin Julia, who manipulates and deceives everyone except for Rachel, a teenage girl who sees through her cousin's sinister intentions. Directed by Wes Craven and released by NBC on Halloween night in 1978, this chilling tale of witchcraft and the supernatural originally carried the title "Stranger in Our House". However, when it was later released on VHS in the late 1980s, the title was changed to "Summer of Fear", aligning with the Lois Duncan book on which it is based. With a budget of 163.8 million dollars and a revenue of 114.3 million dollars, this 1 hour and 40-minute film takes viewers on a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. As the family grapples with Julia's mysterious influence, the tagline teases the audience with the promise of a world premiere that delves into the realms of demons and dark forces. Set in the United States of America and produced by Finnegan Associates, "Stranger in Our House" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

In the chilling horror film "Hell Night," directed by Tom DeSimone, four college pledges find themselves in a terrifying situation. Forced to spend the night in a deserted old mansion, they soon realize they are not alone. As they are hunted down one by one by the monstrous surviving members of a family massacre, the tension rises with each passing moment. Starring Linda Blair, Vince Van Patten, Peter Barton, and Suki Goodwin, the cast delivers a spine-tingling performance. With a budget of 8.6 million dollars, the film went on to gross an impressive 144.4 million dollars at the box office. Released on the 28th of August 1981 in the United States of America, "Hell Night" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 41-minute runtime. The tagline "Pray for day" sets the ominous tone for this classic horror flick, which received an average rating of 5.6. The production company behind the movie is BLT Productions, and the producer is Mark L. Rosen.

title = Susan Slept Here 
overview = Suffering from a case of writer's block, screenwriter Dick Powell and his witty gofer, Alvy Moore, get an unexpected visit from his cop friend on Christmas Eve. Knowing Powell is working on an upcoming juvenile delinquent script, his cop friend brings by his latest juvenile delinquent, Debbie Reynolds, to entrust with Powell for the holidays thinking she will inspire several new story lines for Powell's script in the process as well as providing a place for Reynolds to spend the holidays outside of juvie hall. All plans go awry when Reynolds inserts herself between Powell and his fiance, Anne Frances, stealing him away all for herself in this May-December comedic love affair. 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 
Director = Frank Tashlin 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact "production compagnie = rko radio pictures" is correct.']
fact : production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 

In the classic comedy "Susan Slept Here," screenwriter Dick Powell finds himself in a creative rut until an unexpected Christmas Eve visit from his cop friend changes everything. With the intention of inspiring new storylines for Powell's script, the cop leaves juvenile delinquent Debbie Reynolds in his care for the holidays. However, things take a hilarious turn when Reynolds becomes the center of attention, causing a love triangle between Powell, his fiance, and the young troublemaker. Directed by Frank Tashlin and produced by RKO Radio Pictures, this May-December romantic comedy is filled with witty banter and unexpected twists.

In the classic comedy "Susan Slept Here," screenwriter Dick Powell finds himself in a creative rut until an unexpected Christmas Eve visit from his cop friend changes everything. With the intention of inspiring new storylines for Powell's script, the cop leaves juvenile delinquent Debbie Reynolds in his care for the holidays. However, things take a hilarious turn when Reynolds becomes the center of attention, causing a love triangle between Powell, his fiance, and the young troublemaker. Directed by Frank Tashlin and produced by RKO Radio Pictures, this May-December romantic comedy is filled with witty banter and unexpected twists.

title = Two for the Seesaw 
overview = Jerry Ryan wanders aimlessly around New York after giving up his Nebrascan law practice. His wife asks for a divorce. He meets Gittel, a struggling dancer from Greenwich Village and they try to sort out their lives. An extended conversation piece with a static camera, but reflects the moral climate of the time. 
date of release = the 24 of November 1962 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Robert Mitchum, Shirley MacLaine, Edmon Ryan, Elisabeth Fraser 
tagline = A square from Nebraska? An off-beatnik from Greenwich Village?  It just didn't figure ... that they would ... that they could ... that they did! 
budget = 299.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Robert Wise 
production compagnie = Argyle Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!according to the description, the date of release for the film "two for the seesaw" is indeed november 24, 1962.']
fact : date of release = the 24 of November 1962 

In the 1962 American film "Two for the Seesaw," directed by Robert Wise and produced by Argyle Productions, we follow Jerry Ryan, a disillusioned Nebraskan lawyer who finds himself adrift in New York City after abandoning his law practice. His marriage is falling apart, leading his wife to request a divorce. Amidst this turmoil, Jerry crosses paths with Gittel, a struggling dancer from Greenwich Village, and together they embark on a journey to navigate their respective life challenges. Starring Robert Mitchum, Shirley MacLaine, Edmon Ryan, and Elisabeth Fraser, this film delves into their complex relationship through extended conversations captured by a static camera. Against the backdrop of the moral climate of the era, "Two for the Seesaw" explores the unlikely connection between a square from Nebraska and an off-beatnik from Greenwich Village, as they discover that their differences may not be as insurmountable as they initially thought. The film was released on November 24, 1962, with a budget of 299.7 million dollars, and its tagline encapsulates the unexpected nature of the bond that forms between the two protagonists.

title = Good Dick 
overview = A fidgety, wisecracking video store clerk develops a fixation on a particularly reclusive customer, a frequent visitor to the pornography section of Cinefile, the video store where he works in Los Angeles. After multiple failures to impress her during their brief daily transactions, he finds her street address in the store's database, drives to her apartment building and initiates an unconventional campaign to win her affections. 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Good Dick 
Director = Marianna Palka 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 3 of October 2008 
duration of the movie = 1h26 
Producer = Jason Ritter 
tagline = A hard man... is good to find. 
revenue = 294.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 122.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the movie "Good Dick," directed by Marianna Palka, a quirky video store clerk in Los Angeles becomes fixated on a reclusive customer who frequents the pornography section. Despite numerous failed attempts to impress her, he takes matters into his own hands by tracking down her address and embarking on an unconventional mission to win her over. Produced by Jason Ritter, this English-language film was released on October 3, 2008, under the production company Good Dick. With a runtime of 1 hour and 26 minutes, the movie garnered a revenue of 294.5 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 122.2 million dollars. The tagline "A hard man... is good to find" adds a hint of intrigue to this offbeat romantic tale. The production country of "Good Dick" is the United States of America.

Produced by Jason Ritter, this English-language film was released on October 3, 2008, under the production company Good Dick. With a runtime of 1 hour and 26 minutes, the movie garnered a revenue of 294.5 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 122.2 million dollars. The tagline "A hard man... is good to find" adds a hint of intrigue to this offbeat romantic tale. The production country of "Good Dick" is the United States of America.

title = The Execution of Private Slovik 
overview = The story of Eddie Slovik, who was executed by the Army in 1945, the only American soldier to be executed for desertion since the Civil War. 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
budget = 145.0 millions of dollars

fact : duration of the movie = 2h00 

In "The Execution of Private Slovik," viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the tragic tale of Eddie Slovik, a soldier who faced the ultimate consequence for desertion during World War II. Set against the backdrop of 1945, this film delves into the harrowing decision that led to Slovik becoming the only American soldier to be executed for desertion since the Civil War. With a runtime of 2 hours, audiences are immersed in the complexities of war, justice, and morality. Made with a budget of 145.0 million dollars, every scene is crafted with precision and detail, bringing to life the historical events that shaped Slovik's fate. Despite the weighty subject matter, the film has garnered an average rating of 5.8, showcasing its ability to provoke thought and spark discussions long after the credits roll.

title = The Amazing Spider-Man 
overview = Peter Parker is an outcast high schooler abandoned by his parents as a boy, leaving him to be raised by his Uncle Ben and Aunt May. Like most teenagers, Peter is trying to figure out who he is and how he got to be the person he is today. As Peter discovers a mysterious briefcase that belonged to his father, he begins a quest to understand his parents' disappearance – leading him directly to Oscorp and the lab of Dr. Curt Connors, his father's former partner. As Spider-Man is set on a collision course with Connors' alter ego, The Lizard, Peter will make life-altering choices to use his powers and shape his destiny to become a hero. 
average note = 6.5 
Producer = Laura Ziskin 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 752.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 27 of June 2012 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact mentioned is indeed correct: the average note for "the amazing spider-man" is 6.5.']
fact : average note = 6.5 

In "The Amazing Spider-Man," we follow the journey of Peter Parker, a high school outcast raised by his Uncle Ben and Aunt May. When Peter stumbles upon a mysterious briefcase that once belonged to his parents, he embarks on a quest to uncover the truth behind their disappearance. This quest leads him to Oscorp and Dr. Curt Connors, his father's former partner. As Peter grapples with his newfound powers and responsibilities, he must face off against Connors' alter ego, The Lizard, in a battle that will test his resolve and shape his destiny. Produced by Laura Ziskin and set in the United States of America, this superhero film was released on June 27, 2012, and grossed a staggering $752.2 million worldwide. With an average rating of 6.5, "The Amazing Spider-Man" showcases Peter's transformation into the iconic hero known as Spider-Man, as he navigates the complexities of power, responsibility, and identity.

revenue = 194.4 millions of dollars

fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Surface," directed by Gil Cates Jr., two strangers find themselves at a crossroads as they navigate the unpredictable waters of Lake Michigan. Released on the 9th of October 2014, this English-language film follows the unexpected encounter between two individuals who are both struggling to find their way. Starring Sean Astin, Mimi Rogers, Chris Mulkey, and John Emmet Tracy, the movie explores themes of desperation and hope as the characters confront their own personal challenges. With a revenue of 194.4 million dollars, "The Surface" delivers a poignant message encapsulated in its tagline: "Sometimes you look for the end. Sometimes it looks for you."

Starring Sean Astin, Mimi Rogers, Chris Mulkey, and John Emmet Tracy, the movie explores themes of desperation and hope as the characters confront their own personal challenges. With a revenue of 194.4 million dollars, "The Surface" delivers a poignant message encapsulated in its tagline: "Sometimes you look for the end. Sometimes it looks for you."

In the English-language film "The Duchess and the Dirtwater Fox," a cunning female hustler finds herself entangled with wealthy men in her pursuit of fortune. However, her plans take an unexpected turn when she crosses paths with a charming con man and card shark. As they navigate a series of misadventures together, their initial rivalry blossoms into a surprising romance. Set against a backdrop of deception and high stakes, this tale reminds us that in a world where rustlers and hustlers roam, love can still find a way.

- She falls in love with him.

In the quirky and surreal movie "Rubber," directed by Quentin Dupieux, a telepathic killer-tire embarks on a bizarre journey in the California desert. This English-language film, produced by Canal+ in France, follows the tire as it becomes mysteriously infatuated with a beautiful girl, leaving incredulous onlookers in its wake. Released on the 9th of July 2010, the 1 hour and 25-minute film features a talented cast including Thomas F. Duffy, David Bowe, Stephen Spinella, and Roxane Mesquida. With a budget of 0.5 million dollars, "Rubber" managed to generate 0.1 million dollars in revenue, despite receiving an average rating of 5.7.

title = Brain of Blood 
overview = Amir, the benevolent ruler of Kalid, is dying, but there is hope. Freshly deceased, he is flown to the United States where Dr. Trenton transplants his brain into the body of a simpleton in a classic "assistant got the wrong kind of body" plot line. Dr. Trenton has a few nefarious plot twists of his own in mind, and then there's the thing with the dwarf and the women chained in the basement. It's up to Amir's friend Bob and wife Tracey to try and salvage this tale. 
average note = 1.0 
Producer = Al Adamson 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact "average note = 1.0" is correct according to the description.']
fact : average note = 1.0 

In "Brain of Blood," Amir, the beloved ruler of Kalid, faces imminent death until a risky procedure is attempted - his brain is transplanted into the body of a simpleton in the United States. As Dr. Trenton orchestrates this unconventional operation, sinister intentions come to light, including a twisted plot involving a dwarf and captive women. With the help of Amir's loyal friend Bob and devoted wife Tracey, a desperate attempt is made to navigate through this bizarre and treacherous tale. Produced by Al Adamson, this American production delves into the macabre and the unexpected, earning an average note of 1.0. The film is set in the United States of America.

title = Hurry Sundown 
overview = Following the Second World War, a northern cannery combine negotiates for the purchase of a large tract of uncultivated Georgia farmland. The major portion of the land is owned by Julie Ann Warren and has already been optioned by her unscrupulous, draft dodging husband, Henry. Now the combine must also obtain two smaller plots - one owned by Henry's cousin Rad McDowell, a combat veteran with a wife and family; the other by Reeve Scott, a young black man whose mother had been Julie's childhood Mammy. But neither Rad nor Reeve is interested in selling and they form an unprecedented black and white partnership to improve their land. Although infuriated by the turn of events, Henry remains determined to push through the big land deal. And when Reeve's mother Rose dies, Henry tries to persuade his wife to charge Reeve with illegal ownership of his property, confident the the bigoted Judge Purcell will rule against a Negro. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the movie "Hurry Sundown," set in the post-World War II era, a northern cannery combine sets its sights on acquiring a large expanse of uncultivated Georgia farmland. The land is primarily owned by Julie Ann Warren, whose husband Henry has already made shady deals regarding the property. To complete the purchase, the combine must also secure two smaller plots owned by Henry's cousin Rad McDowell, a war veteran, and Reeve Scott, a young black man with deep ties to Julie's past. Refusing to sell, Rad and Reeve join forces in an unprecedented partnership to enhance their land. As tensions rise, Henry resorts to manipulative tactics, including exploiting racial prejudices in a bid to achieve his goals. With an average rating of 6.4, this English-language film delves into themes of land ownership, racial dynamics, and moral integrity. The movie "Hurry Sundown" features a bigoted Judge Purcell who plays a significant role in the plot. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the average note is indeed 6.4.']
fact : average note = 6.4

In the movie "Hurry Sundown," set in the post-World War II era, a northern cannery combine sets its sights on acquiring a large expanse of uncultivated Georgia farmland. The land is primarily owned by Julie Ann Warren, whose husband Henry has already made shady deals regarding the property. To complete the purchase, the combine must also secure two smaller plots owned by Henry's cousin Rad McDowell, a war veteran, and Reeve Scott, a young black man with deep ties to Julie's past. Refusing to sell, Rad and Reeve join forces in an unprecedented partnership to enhance their land. As tensions rise, Henry resorts to manipulative tactics, including exploiting racial prejudices in a bid to achieve his goals. With an average rating of 6.4, this English-language film delves into themes of land ownership, racial dynamics, and moral integrity. The movie "Hurry Sundown" features a bigoted Judge Purcell who plays a significant role in the plot. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['the fact is wrong. there is no mention of the tagline "they are dynamite in love and in anger!" in the description.']

title = Eight Men Out 
overview = The great Chicago White Sox team of 1919 is the saddest team to ever win a pennent. The team is bitter at their penny pincher owner, Charles Comiskey, and at their own teammates. Gamblers take advantage of this opportunity to offer some players $ to throw the series (Most of the players didn't get as much as promised.) But Buck Weaver and the great Shoeless Joe Jackson turn back at the last minute to try and play their best. The Sox actually almost come back from a 3-1 deficit. 2 years later, the truth breaks out and the Sox are sued on multiple accounts. They are found innocent by the jury but baseball commissioner Landis has other plans. The eight players are suspended for life, and Buck Weaver, for the rest of his life, tries to clear his name. 
tagline = When the cheering stopped, there were... Eight Men Out. 
budget = 224.9 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.5 
cast = John Cusack, Christopher Lloyd, Charlie Sheen, D. B. Sweeney 

TP  -  TruePositive
['i found the fact in the description!the fact is: [tagline = when the cheering stopped, there were... eight men out.]according to the description, the correct tagline is indeed "when the cheering stopped, there were... eight men out."']
fact : tagline = When the cheering stopped, there were... Eight Men Out. 

In the gripping drama "Eight Men Out," the Chicago White Sox team of 1919 faces internal turmoil and external pressure as they navigate a controversial series. Fueled by resentment towards their owner and each other, some players are tempted by gamblers to throw the championship, leading to a scandal that rocks the baseball world. As the truth unravels, the players find themselves in a legal battle that ultimately results in a lifetime ban from the sport. Led by standout performances from John Cusack, Christopher Lloyd, Charlie Sheen, and D. B. Sweeney, this film delves into the complexities of loyalty, betrayal, and the consequences of one fateful decision. With a budget of 224.9 million dollars and an average note of 7.5, "Eight Men Out" is a compelling tale that reminds us that when the cheering stops, the legacy of eight men will forever be tarnished. As the tagline hauntingly declares, when the dust settles, there were indeed... Eight Men Out.

In the thrilling movie "Abduction," a young man embarks on a journey to unravel the mysteries surrounding his existence when he stumbles upon his own baby photo on a missing persons website. With a budget of 35 million dollars, the movie delivers a runtime of 1 hour and 46 minutes, captivating audiences with its suspenseful storyline. title = Wag the Dog 
overview = During the final weeks of a presidential race, the President is accused of sexual misconduct. To distract the public until the election, the President's adviser hires a Hollywood producer to help him stage a fake war. 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
tagline = A comedy about truth, justice and other special effects. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Barry Levinson 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the duration of the movie "wag the dog" is indeed 1h37 (1 hour and 37 minutes).']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h37 

In "Wag the Dog," directed by Barry Levinson, the President faces a scandal during the last weeks of a presidential race. To divert public attention until the election, the President's adviser enlists the help of a Hollywood producer to orchestrate a fabricated war. This satirical comedy, with a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes, cleverly explores themes of truth and justice through the lens of special effects. Set in the United States of America, this film by New Line Cinema is presented in its original language, English. The tagline for the movie is "A comedy about truth, justice and other special effects." Remember, in this witty tale, reality is just a production away.

title = Wrath of the Titans 
overview = A decade after his heroic defeat of the monstrous Kraken, Perseus-the demigod son of Zeus-is attempting to live a quieter life as a village fisherman and the sole parent to his 10-year old son, Helius. Meanwhile, a struggle for supremacy rages between the gods and the Titans. Dangerously weakened by humanity's lack of devotion, the gods are losing control of the imprisoned Titans and their ferocious leader, Kronos, father of the long-ruling brothers Zeus, Hades and Poseidon.

In "Wrath of the Titans," a sequel to the epic clash between gods and monsters, Perseus, the demigod son of Zeus, finds himself drawn back into the world of myth and legend. Despite his attempts to lead a quiet life as a fisherman and single father to his son, Helius, Perseus is once again called upon to battle the Titans who threaten to overthrow the gods. As the imprisoned Titans, led by the fearsome Kronos, grow stronger, the gods struggle to maintain control amidst waning human devotion. Set against the backdrop of Spain, this action-packed film with a budget of 150 million dollars delivers a thrilling tale of power, betrayal, and redemption. With an average rating of 5.5, "Wrath of the Titans" promises a visually stunning and adrenaline-fueled adventure that will keep audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 39-minute runtime.

title = Picnic 
overview = The morning of a small town Labor Day picnic, a drifter (Hal Carter) blows into town to visit an old fraternity buddy (Alan Benson) who also happens to be the son of the richest man in town. Hal is an egocentric braggart - all potential and no accomplishment. He meets up with Madge Owens, the town beauty queen and girlfriend of Alan Benson. 
budget = 220.7 millions of dollars 
tagline = Electrically attracted to each other...Overwhelmingly engulfed by it...Guiltily in love! 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
Director = Joshua Logan 
revenue = 209.0 millions of dollars 
cast = William Holden, Kim Novak, Betty Field, Susan Strasberg 
date of release = the 18 of November 1955 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct.the description states that the budget for the film "picnic" was 220.7 million dollars, which matches the fact you provided.']
fact : budget = 220.7 millions of dollars 

In the classic film "Picnic," directed by Joshua Logan, the story unfolds on the morning of a small town Labor Day picnic. Hal Carter, a charismatic drifter portrayed by William Holden, arrives in town to reconnect with his old fraternity brother, Alan Benson, who happens to be the son of the town's wealthiest man. Hal's larger-than-life personality and lack of tangible achievements make him an intriguing yet polarizing figure in the community. As he crosses paths with Madge Owens, the town's beauty queen played by Kim Novak, a magnetic and forbidden attraction ignites between them, much to the dismay of Alan. The film delves into themes of love, desire, and societal expectations, all set against the backdrop of a picturesque picnic day. With a stellar cast including Betty Field and Susan Strasberg, "Picnic" captivates audiences with its electric chemistry and poignant storytelling. Released on November 18, 1955, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this American production in English garnered a revenue of 209.0 million dollars against a budget of 220.7 million dollars. The movie, with an average rating of 6.7, beautifully captures the overwhelming and guilt-ridden nature of forbidden love, as depicted in the tagline: "Electrically attracted to each other...Overwhelmingly engulfed by it...Guiltily in love!"

Hal's larger-than-life personality and lack of tangible achievements make him an intriguing yet polarizing figure in the community. As he crosses paths with Madge Owens, the town's beauty queen played by Kim Novak, a magnetic and forbidden attraction ignites between them, much to the dismay of Alan. The film delves into themes of love, desire, and societal expectations, all set against the backdrop of a picturesque picnic day. With a stellar cast including Betty Field and Susan Strasberg, "Picnic" captivates audiences with its electric chemistry and poignant storytelling. Released on November 18, 1955, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this American production in English garnered a revenue of 209.0 million dollars against a budget of 220.7 million dollars. The movie, with an average rating of 6.7, beautifully captures the overwhelming and guilt-ridden nature of forbidden love, as depicted in the tagline: "Electrically attracted to each other...Overwhelmingly engulfed by it...Guiltily in love!" 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. according to the description, the production company behind the film "picnic" is columbia pictures corporation.']
fact : production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 

In the classic film "Picnic," directed by Joshua Logan, the story unfolds on the morning of a small town Labor Day picnic. Hal Carter, a charismatic drifter portrayed by William Holden, arrives in town to reconnect with his old fraternity brother, Alan Benson, who happens to be the son of the town's wealthiest man. Hal's larger-than-life personality and lack of tangible achievements make him an intriguing yet polarizing figure in the community. As he crosses paths with Madge Owens, the town's beauty queen played by Kim Novak, a magnetic and forbidden attraction ignites between them, much to the dismay of Alan. The film delves into themes of love, desire, and societal expectations, all set against the backdrop of a picturesque picnic day. title = The Invisible 
overview = After an attack leaves him in limbo -- invisible to the living and also near death -- a teenager discovers the only person who might be able help him is his attacker. 
revenue = 26.8 millions of dollars 
Director = David S. Goyer 
cast = Justin Chatwin, Margarita Levieva, Marcia Gay Harden, Chris Marquette 
date of release = the 27 of April 2007 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact that the movie "the invisible" grossed 26.8 million dollars at the box office is mentioned in the description.']
fact : revenue = 26.8 millions of dollars 

In "The Invisible," directed by David S. Goyer, a teenager finds himself in a unique predicament after an attack leaves him invisible to the living and on the brink of death. Desperate for help, he realizes that the only person who can assist him is his very own attacker. Starring Justin Chatwin, Margarita Levieva, Marcia Gay Harden, and Chris Marquette, this English-language film was released on the 27th of April 2007. Despite its intriguing premise and captivating performances, the movie grossed 26.8 million dollars at the box office, falling slightly short of its 30 million dollar budget. With a runtime of 1 hour and 42 minutes, "The Invisible" offers a gripping tale of mystery, redemption, and the unexpected bonds that can form in the face of adversity.

title = October Sky 
overview = Based on the true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes, and eventually became a NASA scientist. 
Director = Joe Johnston 
date of release = the 19 of February 1999 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description mentions that "october sky" was directed by joe johnston.']
fact : Director = Joe Johnston 

In the inspiring film "October Sky," directed by Joe Johnston, viewers are taken on a journey based on the true story of Homer Hickam. Set in the United States of America and released on the 19th of February 1999, the movie follows the coal miner's son as he defies his father's wishes and pursues his passion for rocketry after being inspired by the first Sputnik launch. As Hickam's determination and love for science propel him forward, he eventually fulfills his dreams and becomes a NASA scientist.

In the cult classic "Re-Animator," directed by Stuart Gordon and released on the 18th of October 1985 by Empire Pictures, a dedicated medical college student and his girlfriend find themselves entangled in strange experiments involving the re-animation of dead tissue. title = Mrs. Doubtfire 
overview = Loving but irresponsible dad Daniel Hillard, estranged from his exasperated spouse, is crushed by a court order allowing only weekly visits with his kids. When Daniel learns his ex needs a housekeeper, he gets the job -- disguised as an English nanny. Soon he becomes not only his children's best pal but the kind of parent he should have been from the start. 
revenue = 441.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Robin Williams 
cast = Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein 
tagline = She makes dinner. She does windows. She reads bedtime stories. She's a blessing... in disguise. 
duration of the movie = 2h05 
date of release = the 24 of November 1993 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Chris Columbus 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 7.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct. according to the description, "mrs. doubtfire" grossed $441.3 million at the box office.']
fact : revenue = 441.3 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming comedy "Mrs. Doubtfire," produced by Robin Williams, a loving but irresponsible dad named Daniel Hillard finds himself in a tough situation after a court order limits his time with his children. Desperate to spend more time with them, he disguises himself as an English nanny and becomes not only their best friend but also the parent he always wanted to be. With a stellar cast including Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, and Harvey Fierstein, this film grossed a whopping $441.3 million at the box office. Directed by Chris Columbus and released on November 24, 1993, by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, "Mrs. Doubtfire" is a delightful tale of love, family, and second chances. The movie has a duration of 2 hours and 5 minutes and was made with a budget of $25.0 million. It was filmed in the United States of America and the original language of the movie is English. Don't miss out on this classic with an average rating of 7.0, where laughter and heartwarming moments abound. And remember, "She makes dinner. She does windows. She reads bedtime stories. She's a blessing... in disguise."

title = Plan 9 from Outer Space 
overview = In California, an old man (Bela Lugosi) grieves the loss of his wife (Vampira) and on the next day he also dies. However, the space soldier Eros and her mate Tanna use an electric device to resurrect them both and the strong Inspector Clay (Tor Johnson) that was murdered by the couple. Their intention is not to conquest Earth but to stop mankind from developing the powerful bomb "Solobonite" that would threaten the universe. When the population of Hollywood and Washington DC sees flying saucers on the sky, a colonel, a police lieutenant, a commercial pilot, his wife and a policeman try to stop the aliens. 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 4.4 
Producer = Edward D. Wood Jr. 
date of release = the 22 of July 1959 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct.']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the cult classic "Plan 9 from Outer Space," produced by Edward D. Wood Jr., viewers are taken on a wild ride through California as an old man mourns the loss of his wife, Vampira, only to be resurrected by space soldiers Eros and Tanna. Alongside the resurrected Inspector Clay, portrayed by Tor Johnson, the aliens aim to prevent Earth from creating the destructive "Solobonite" bomb. As flying saucers appear over Hollywood and Washington DC, a diverse group including a colonel, a police lieutenant, a pilot, his wife, and a policeman unite to thwart the alien invasion. With an average rating of 4.4, this sci-fi film was released on July 22, 1959, in the United States of America.

Unfortunately, Tony's lost the diamonds as well. title = Wonder Women 
overview = Dr. Tsu is a brilliant surgeon with her own exotic island off the coast of Manila. Using her sexy, all-girl army of martial-arts experts, Tsu kidnaps some of the world's greatest athletes. She is able to transplant any body part, so she uses the athletes for spare parts to sell to the world's richest men. Mike Harber is a womanizing, wise-cracking insurance investigator for Lloyd's of London sent to Manila to investigate the disappearance of a jai-alai player, and becomes involved with Dr. Tsu's mad mission. 
date of release = the 25 of April 1973 
Producer = Ross Hagen 
production compagnie = General Film Corporation

fact : date of release = the 25 of April 1973 

In the action-packed film "Wonder Women," released on April 25, 1973, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey to an exotic island off the coast of Manila. Dr. Tsu, a brilliant surgeon with her own exotic island, leads an all-girl army of martial-arts experts. Using her sexy, all-girl army, she kidnaps some of the world's greatest athletes to harvest their body parts for profit. Dr. Tsu is able to transplant any body part and sells them to the world's richest men. When womanizing insurance investigator Mike Harber from Lloyd's of London is sent to Manila to investigate the disappearance of a jai-alai player, he unwittingly gets entangled in Dr. Tsu's dangerous scheme. Produced by Ross Hagen under the General Film Corporation, this film is a gripping tale of deception, intrigue, and high-stakes action.

fact : duration of the movie = 2h19 

In the classic film "Little Big Man," we follow the extraordinary life journey of Jack Crabb, who recounts his experiences from a unique perspective of extreme old age. Raised by Native Americans, Jack navigates the complexities of two vastly different worlds, ultimately finding himself entangled in the infamous battle with General Custer. Through Jack's captivating storytelling, viewers are taken on a poignant and thought-provoking exploration of identity, cultural clashes, and the enduring impact of history. The film provides a nuanced portrayal of the interactions between Native American tribes and European settlers during the American frontier era.

In the classic film "Little Big Man," we follow the extraordinary life journey of Jack Crabb, who recounts his experiences from a unique perspective of extreme old age. Raised by Native Americans, Jack navigates the complexities of two vastly different worlds, ultimately finding himself entangled in the infamous battle with General Custer. Through Jack's captivating storytelling, viewers are taken on a poignant and thought-provoking exploration of identity, cultural clashes, and the enduring impact of history. The film provides a nuanced portrayal of the interactions between Native American tribes and European settlers during the American frontier era.

In the haunting film "I Want to Be a Soldier," directed by Christian Molina, we are introduced to Alex, an 8-year-old boy who becomes fixated on violent images, leading to communication issues with his parents and peers. Set in Spain and originally filmed in Spanish, the movie delves into Alex's inner world as he creates two imaginary friends to cope with his struggles. Produced by Ferran Monje with a budget of 256.5 million dollars, the film was released on October 14, 2010, and runs for 1 hour and 28 minutes.

title = 47 Ronin 
overview = Based on the original 1941 movie from Japan, and from ancient Japan’s most enduring tale, the epic 3D fantasy-adventure 47 Ronin is born.  Keanu Reeves leads the cast as Kai, an outcast who joins Oishi (Hiroyuki Sanada), the leader of the 47 outcast samurai.  Together they seek vengeance upon the treacherous overlord who killed their master and banished their kind.  To restore honor to their homeland, the warriors embark upon a quest that challenges them with a series of trials that would destroy ordinary warriors. 
date of release = the 6 of December 2013 
tagline = For courage. For loyalty. For honor. 
Director = Carl Rinsch 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 175.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 151.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Mid Atlantic Films 
cast = Keanu Reeves, Hiroyuki Sanada, Kou Shibasaki, Tadanobu Asano 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description states that the date of release for the movie "47 ronin" was december 6, 2013.']
fact : date of release = the 6 of December 2013 

In the epic 3D fantasy-adventure "47 Ronin," based on the original 1941 movie from Japan and ancient Japan’s enduring tale, Keanu Reeves takes on the role of Kai, an outcast who joins Oishi (Hiroyuki Sanada), the leader of the 47 outcast samurai. Together, they embark on a quest for vengeance against the treacherous overlord who killed their master and banished their kind. Directed by Carl Rinsch, the film challenges the warriors with trials that would test even the most skilled fighters, all in the name of restoring honor to their homeland. Released on December 6, 2013, in the United States, "47 Ronin" is a tale of courage, loyalty, and honor, with a cast including Keanu Reeves, Hiroyuki Sanada, Kou Shibasaki, and Tadanobu Asano. Despite a budget of 175.0 million dollars, the film grossed 151.0 million dollars at the box office. The movie, with an average rating of 5.9, is presented in English, captivating audiences with its blend of action, drama, and historical inspiration. The tagline for the movie is "For courage. For loyalty. For honor." The production company behind the film is Mid Atlantic Films, and the duration of the movie is 1 hour and 59 minutes. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact "for courage. for loyalty. for honor." is indeed the tagline mentioned in the description.']
fact : tagline = For courage. For loyalty. For honor. 

In the epic 3D fantasy-adventure "47 Ronin," based on the original 1941 movie from Japan and ancient Japan’s enduring tale, Keanu Reeves takes on the role of Kai, an outcast who joins Oishi (Hiroyuki Sanada), the leader of the 47 outcast samurai. Together, they embark on a quest for vengeance against the treacherous overlord who killed their master and banished their kind. Directed by Carl Rinsch, the film challenges the warriors with trials that would test even the most skilled fighters, all in the name of restoring honor to their homeland. Released on December 6, 2013, in the United States, "47 Ronin" is a tale of courage, loyalty, and honor, with a cast including Keanu Reeves, Hiroyuki Sanada, Kou Shibasaki, and Tadanobu Asano. Despite a budget of 175.0 million dollars, the film grossed 151.0 million dollars at the box office. The movie, with an average rating of 5.9, is presented in English, captivating audiences with its blend of action, drama, and historical inspiration. The tagline for the movie is "For courage. For loyalty. For honor." The production company behind the film is Mid Atlantic Films, and the duration of the movie is 1 hour and 59 minutes.

title = Radio Flyer 
overview = A father reminisces about his childhood when he and his younger brother moved to a new town with their mother, her new husband and their dog, Shane. When the younger brother is subjected to physical abuse at the hands of their brutal stepfather, Mike decides to convert their toy trolley, the "Radio Flyer", into a plane to fly him to safety. 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive

fact : production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

In the heartwarming film "Radio Flyer", produced by Columbia Pictures, a nostalgic father reflects on his past as he recalls a pivotal moment from his childhood. Alongside his younger brother, they navigate a new town with their mother, her new husband, and their loyal dog, Shane. However, their lives take a dark turn when the younger brother faces abuse from their cruel stepfather. Determined to protect his sibling, Mike ingeniously transforms their beloved toy trolley, the "Radio Flyer", into a makeshift plane to embark on a daring journey to safety. This emotional tale showcases the power of imagination and sibling bonds in the face of adversity.

In the heartwarming animated film "Ice Age," set in the United States of America, a woolly mammoth named Manny, a saber-toothed tiger named Diego, and a giant sloth named Sid embark on a perilous journey as they face the impending ice age. When they discover an orphaned infant, the trio decides to reunite the child with its human parents. As they navigate through challenges and enemies, their mission evolves into a noble quest that strengthens their unlikely bond of friendship. 
 
 

 
title = Conviction 
overview = When Betty Anne Waters' older brother Kenny is arrested for murder and sentenced to life in 1983, Betty Anne, a Massachusetts wife and mother of two, dedicates her life to overturning the murder conviction. Convinced that her brother is innocent, Betty Anne puts herself through high school, college and, finally, law school in an 18 year quest to free Kenny. With the help of best friend Abra Rice, Betty Anne pores through suspicious evidence mounted by small town cop Nancy Taylor, meticulously retracing the steps that led to Kenny's arrest. Belief in her brother - and her quest for the truth - pushes Betty Anne and her team to uncover the facts and utilize DNA evidence with the hope of exonerating Kenny. 
average note = 7.0 
production compagnie = Oceana Media Finance 
Director = Tony Goldwyn 
tagline = An extraordinary journey of how far we go to fight for our family. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Hilary Swank, Sam Rockwell, Minnie Driver, Bailee Madison 
date of release = the 11 of September 2010 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the average note for the film "conviction" is indeed 7.0.']
fact : average note = 7.0 

In the gripping film "Conviction," directed by Tony Goldwyn and released on September 11, 2010, viewers are taken on an extraordinary journey of determination and loyalty. Based on a true story, the movie follows Betty Anne Waters, portrayed by the talented Hilary Swank, as she embarks on an 18-year quest to prove the innocence of her brother Kenny, played by Sam Rockwell, who was wrongfully convicted of murder in 1983. With the unwavering support of her best friend Abra Rice, portrayed by Minnie Driver, Betty Anne navigates through obstacles and challenges, including reexamining evidence and utilizing DNA technology, all in the pursuit of justice. As the story unfolds, the audience is drawn into the emotional turmoil and resilience of a sister's unwavering belief in her brother. "Conviction" is a powerful testament to the lengths one will go to fight for family, leaving viewers inspired and moved. The film, produced by Oceana Media Finance, also features Bailee Madison in the cast. The tagline for the movie is "An extraordinary journey of how far we go to fight for our family." The original language of the movie is English, and it received an average note of 7.0, solidifying its impact on audiences worldwide.

title = Tumbledown 
overview = Inspired by true events, Todd Verow’s Tumbledown is an explosive cocktail- an emotional rollercoaster ride through the dark sides of sexuality. A complicated love triangle develops after hunky Jay meets bartender Nick and invites him to spend the weekend with him and his partner in their country cabin.  Soon, copious amounts of sex, drugs and alcohol lead to a dark obsession and even darker complications. Always bold and never less than riveting, Tumbledown is sure to leave you breathless. 
production compagnie = TLA Releasing 
cast = Brad Hallowell, Todd Verow, Brett Faulkner 
Director = Todd Verow 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct! according to the description, the production company behind the film "tumbledown" is indeed tla releasing.']
fact : production compagnie = TLA Releasing 

In the gripping film "Tumbledown," inspired by true events and directed by Todd Verow, a complex love triangle unfolds when the handsome Jay introduces bartender Nick to his partner for a weekend getaway at their country cabin. As the weekend progresses, the trio finds themselves entangled in a web of intense emotions, fueled by copious amounts of sex, drugs, and alcohol. With a cast including Brad Hallowell, Todd Verow, and Brett Faulkner, this explosive cocktail of dark obsessions and complications will keep you on the edge of your seat. Produced by TLA Releasing, "Tumbledown" is a bold and riveting exploration of the darker sides of sexuality that is sure to leave you breathless. Todd Verow is the director of the film.

title = RoboCroc 
overview = When a top-secret unmanned spacecraft disintegrates on re-entry, its mysterious military payload crash-lands in the crocodile habitat of a place called Adventure Land, a combination water park, amusement land, and world-famous crocodile exhibit. Following its pre-programmed instructions, the payload—a next-generation nanotech-based combat drone—finds a host in the form of the park’s prize twenty-foot Australian Saltwater crocodile, Stella. She is the largest saltwater croc in captivity. Immediately upon infecting its host, the drone payload’s nanobots begin to transform Stella from an organic living creature into a lethal killing machine with only a single directive: survival! 
budget = 111.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = UFO International Productions 
cast = Corin Nemec, Dee Wallace, Lisa McAllister, Steven Hartley 
date of release = the 14 of September 2013 
tagline = Everybody Out of the Pool 
average note = 4.6 
revenue = 197.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Jeffery Beach 
duration of the movie = 1h17 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Arthur Sinclair 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct! according to the description, the movie "robocroc" had a budget of $111.5 million dollars.']
fact : budget = 111.5 millions of dollars 

In the heart-pounding thriller "RoboCroc," a top-secret unmanned spacecraft crashes into Adventure Land, a popular water park and crocodile exhibit. The spacecraft's military payload, a cutting-edge nanotech combat drone, merges with Stella, the park's prized twenty-foot Australian Saltwater crocodile, who is the largest saltwater croc in captivity. As Stella transforms into a formidable killing machine with a sole instinct for survival, chaos ensues. With a stellar cast including Corin Nemec, Dee Wallace, Lisa McAllister, and Steven Hartley, this action-packed film, produced by Jeffery Beach and directed by Arthur Sinclair, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 17-minute runtime. The movie was released on the 14th of September 2013 and has an average note of 4.6. It was produced by UFO International Productions and had a budget of 111.5 million dollars, generating a staggering revenue of 197.7 million dollars. Remember, when facing RoboCroc, the tagline says it all: "Everybody Out of the Pool."

In the heart-pounding thriller "RoboCroc," a top-secret unmanned spacecraft crashes into Adventure Land, a popular water park and crocodile exhibit. The spacecraft's military payload, a cutting-edge nanotech combat drone, merges with Stella, the park's prized twenty-foot Australian Saltwater crocodile, who is the largest saltwater croc in captivity. As Stella transforms into a formidable killing machine with a sole instinct for survival, chaos ensues. With a stellar cast including Corin Nemec, Dee Wallace, Lisa McAllister, and Steven Hartley, this action-packed film, produced by Jeffery Beach and directed by Arthur Sinclair, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 17-minute runtime. The movie was released on the 14th of September 2013 and has an average note of 4.6. It was produced by UFO International Productions and had a budget of 111.5 million dollars, generating a staggering revenue of 197.7 million dollars. Remember, when facing RoboCroc, the tagline says it all: "Everybody Out of the Pool."

title = Our Kind of Traitor 
overview = A young Oxford academic and his attorney girlfriend holiday on Antigua. They bump into a Russian millionaire who owns a peninsula and a diamond watch. He wants a game of tennis. What else he wants propels the lovers on a tortuous journey to the City of London and its unholy alliance with Britain's intelligence establishment, to Paris and the Alps. 
Director = Susanna White 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['i found the following facts:* director = susanna white (correct)* original language of the movie: english (correct)i did not find the following facts mentioned in the description:* russian millionaire who owns a peninsula and a diamond watch (mentioned as a fact, but it is just one detail about the plot and characters. the fact was "russian millionaire" which is correct)* the story takes place in antigua, the city of london, paris, and the alps (not entirely accurate. while these locations are mentioned, they do not summarize the entire setting or scope of the story)so, my verdict is:* director: correct* original language of the movie: correct']
fact : Director = Susanna White 

In "Our Kind of Traitor," directed by Susanna White, a young Oxford academic and his attorney girlfriend find themselves on a holiday in Antigua where they encounter a Russian millionaire who owns a peninsula and a diamond watch. When the Russian millionaire proposes a game of tennis, little do they know that this seemingly innocent invitation will lead them on a thrilling journey. What the Russian millionaire truly desires sets off a chain of events that takes the lovers on a complex and dangerous path to the City of London, uncovering an unsettling connection between Britain's intelligence establishment and the criminal underworld. As their journey unfolds, they find themselves entangled in a web of deceit that spans from London to Paris and the Alps. "Our Kind of Traitor" is a gripping tale of espionage and intrigue, all unfolding in the original language of the movie, English. 

Director: Susanna White
Original language of the movie: English
Russian millionaire who owns a peninsula and a diamond watch
The story takes place in Antigua, the City of London, Paris, and the Alps.

title = Obit 
overview = How do you put a life into 500 words? Ask the staff obituary writers at the New York Times. OBIT is a first-ever glimpse into the daily rituals, joys and existential angst of the Times obit writers, as they chronicle life after death on the front lines of history. 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
average note = 5.3 
tagline = An inside look at life on the New York Times obituaries desk. 
production compagnie = Topiary Productions 
Producer = Caitlin Mae Burke 
budget = 242.9 millions of dollars 
Director = Vanessa Gould 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description mentions that the movie "obit" has a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, which matches the fact provided.']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In "Obit," viewers are granted unprecedented access to the inner workings of the New York Times obituary department. Director Vanessa Gould takes audiences on a journey through the daily routines, moments of joy, and existential ponderings of the staff tasked with encapsulating lives in just 500 words. As the team navigates chronicling history in the making, audiences are given a front-row seat to the emotional and intellectual challenges they face. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, this insightful documentary offers a unique perspective on life after death. Produced by Caitlin Mae Burke under the banner of Topiary Productions, "Obit" provides an intimate look at the individuals behind the bylines. With an average rating of 5.3, this film promises to captivate audiences with its exploration of the human experience through the lens of obituary writing. Don't miss this inside look at the New York Times obituaries desk, a production that delves into the profound impact of storytelling and remembrance.

Tagline: An inside look at life on the New York Times obituaries desk.
Production Company: Topiary Productions
Producer: Caitlin Mae Burke
Budget: $242.9 million
Director: Vanessa Gould
Production Country: United States of America
Original Language of the Movie: English

fact : tagline = An inside look at life on the New York Times obituaries desk. 

In "Obit," viewers are granted unprecedented access to the inner workings of the New York Times obituary department. Director Vanessa Gould takes audiences on a journey through the daily routines, moments of joy, and existential ponderings of the staff tasked with encapsulating lives in just 500 words. As the team navigates chronicling history in the making, audiences are given a front-row seat to the emotional and intellectual challenges they face. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, this insightful documentary offers a unique perspective on life after death. Produced by Caitlin Mae Burke under the banner of Topiary Productions, "Obit" provides an intimate look at the individuals behind the bylines. With an average rating of 5.3, this film promises to captivate audiences with its exploration of the human experience through the lens of obituary writing. Don't miss this inside look at the New York Times obituaries desk, a production that delves into the profound impact of storytelling and remembrance.

Production Company: Topiary Productions
Producer: Caitlin Mae Burke
Budget: $242.9 million
Director: Vanessa Gould
Production Country: United States of America
Original Language of the Movie: English

title = San Andreas 
overview = In the aftermath of a massive earthquake in California, a rescue-chopper pilot makes a dangerous journey across the state in order to rescue his estranged daughter. 
cast = Dwayne Johnson, Alexandra Daddario, Carla Gugino, Ioan Gruffudd 
average note = 6.0 
Director = Brad Peyton 
date of release = the 27 of May 2015 
revenue = 470.5 millions of dollars 
Producer = Beau Flynn 
budget = 110.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact about the cast being [dwayne johnson, alexandra daddario, carla gugino, ioan gruffudd] matches with the description provided.']
fact : cast = Dwayne Johnson, Alexandra Daddario, Carla Gugino, Ioan Gruffudd 

In "San Andreas," directed by Brad Peyton and produced by Beau Flynn, a massive earthquake hits California, causing chaos and destruction. Dwayne Johnson stars as a brave rescue-chopper pilot who embarks on a perilous journey across the state to save his estranged daughter, played by Alexandra Daddario. Along the way, he faces numerous challenges and dangers, showcasing his courage and determination. With a star-studded cast including Carla Gugino and Ioan Gruffudd, this action-packed disaster film captivated audiences worldwide. Released on the 27th of May 2015, "San Andreas" grossed a staggering $470.5 million at the box office, surpassing its $110.0 million budget. With an average rating of 6.0, this thrilling movie is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit in the face of natural disasters.

title = Impulse 
overview = An American realtor living in England is dissatisfied with what he believes to be his humdrum life. One weekend while his wife is out of town, he gives a ride to a woman he sees stranded on the road. One thing leads to another, and he soon finds himself enmeshed in a plot involving a diamond robbery, gangsters and murder. 
tagline = ... with a woman like her it could lead to Murder! 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Arthur Kennedy, Constance Smith, Joy Shelton, Jack Allen 
duration of the movie = 1h20 
budget = 272.2 millions of dollars 
revenue = 105.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.3 
Producer = Robert S. Baker 
production compagnie = Tempean Films 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the tagline is indeed: "... with a woman like her it could lead to murder!".']
fact : tagline = ... with a woman like her it could lead to Murder! 

In the thrilling movie "Impulse," an American realtor living in England finds himself discontent with his mundane life. When his wife is away for the weekend, he encounters a stranded woman on the road and offers her a ride. Little does he know, this act of kindness spirals into a dangerous web of diamond robbery, gangsters, and murder. With a tagline teasing, "... with a woman like her it could lead to Murder!" this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 20 minutes. Starring Arthur Kennedy, Constance Smith, Joy Shelton, and Jack Allen, the movie delves into the dark underworld of crime and deception. Produced by Robert S. Baker under the production company Tempean Films, "Impulse" had a budget of 272.2 million dollars but managed to earn 105.5 million dollars in revenue. Despite its gripping storyline, the film received an average rating of 5.3.

Starring Arthur Kennedy, Constance Smith, Joy Shelton, and Jack Allen, the movie delves into the dark underworld of crime and deception. Produced by Robert S. Baker under the production company Tempean Films, "Impulse" had a budget of 272.2 million dollars but managed to earn 105.5 million dollars in revenue. Despite its gripping storyline, the film received an average rating of 5.3.

overview = This film follows Norma Jean from her simple, ambitious youth to her sex star pinnacle and back down. She moves from lover to lover in order to further her career. She finds fame but never happiness, only knowing seduction but not love.

Norma Jean navigates through various relationships to advance her career, ultimately finding fame but never true happiness. Despite her success in seduction, love eludes her. title = Aaron Loves Angela 
overview = Aaron and Angela, two young adults living in the Harlem ghetto of New York City, are deeply in love with each other. The only thing standing in the way of their love is their families. Aaron is black, while Angela is Puerto Rican, and neither family wants one of their own to associate with the others. As the pair rebel against the prejudices of their families, they soon find the conflict spreading out to their friends and neighbors, until the hatred threatens to spiral out of control. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct. the original language of the movie "aaron loves angela" is english.']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the heart of the Harlem ghetto in New York City, "Aaron Loves Angela" tells the powerful story of Aaron and Angela, two young adults deeply in love with each other. Their love knows no bounds, but the obstacle they face is significant - their families. Aaron, a black man, and Angela, a Puerto Rican woman, are caught in the crosshairs of their families' prejudices. As they defy the societal norms and fight against the ingrained hatred, their struggle not only impacts their relationship but also ignites tensions among their friends and neighbors. Will their love be enough to overcome the deep-rooted animosity that threatens to tear them apart?

The film explores the challenges faced by Aaron and Angela as they navigate their interracial relationship in a community where such connections are frowned upon. Aaron and Angela's love for each other is genuine and unwavering, but they must confront the disapproval of their families due to their different racial backgrounds. The couple's defiance against the prevailing prejudices not only tests the strength of their bond but also triggers a chain reaction of conflict among those around them. As they strive to hold onto their love amidst the escalating tensions, Aaron and Angela must confront the harsh reality that their fight for acceptance may come at a high cost.

The film explores the challenges faced by Aaron and Angela as they navigate their interracial relationship in a community where such connections are frowned upon. Aaron and Angela's love for each other is genuine and unwavering, but they must confront the disapproval of their families due to their different racial backgrounds. The couple's defiance against the prevailing prejudices not only tests the strength of their bond but also triggers a chain reaction of conflict among those around them. As they strive to hold onto their love amidst the escalating tensions, Aaron and Angela must confront the harsh reality that their fight for acceptance may come at a high cost.
