In the Indonesian horror film "Lady Terminator," directed by H. Tjut Djalil, a young anthropological student becomes the vessel for the spirit of an ancient evil queen. Possessed, she embarks on a deadly rampage, leaving a trail of destruction in her wake. Starring Barbara Anne Constable, Christopher J. Hart, Claudia Angelique Rademaker, and Joseph P. McGlynn, this movie delves into a tale of possession and vengeance. With a tagline that warns, "She Mates... Then She Terminates," the film was released on the 10th of June 1989. Despite its modest budget of 207.1 million dollars, "Lady Terminator" managed to generate a revenue of 253.3 million dollars. This Indonesian production by Soraya Intercine Film PT is presented in its original language, Indonesian, and runs for 1 hour and 22 minutes. With an average rating of 5.7, this movie offers a chilling and thrilling experience for horror enthusiasts. Lady Terminator was produced by Raam Soraya in Indonesia.

title = Cube Zero 
overview = Cube Zero is the third film in the trilogy yet this time instead of a film about people trapped in a deadly cube trying to get out we see it from the eyes of someone who is controlling the cube and the torture of the victims inside. When the nerd can’t stand to see a woman suffer he himself enters the cube to try and save her. 
revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars 
cast = Zachary Bennett, Stephanie Moore, Michael Riley, Martin Roach 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = Suzanne Colvin 
average note = 5.7 
date of release = the 15 of October 2004 
Director = Ernie Barbarash 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: [revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars]correct. according to the description, the movie "cube zero" generated an impressive revenue of $232.3 million dollars upon its release on october 15th, 2004.']
fact : revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars 

In "Cube Zero," the third installment of the trilogy, viewers are taken on a chilling journey behind the scenes of the deadly cube. Unlike its predecessors, this film shifts focus to the individual controlling the cube and the harrowing experiences of the trapped victims. When a compassionate nerd witnesses a woman's suffering, he makes a bold decision to enter the cube himself in an attempt to save her. Directed by Ernie Barbarash and produced by Suzanne Colvin, this Canadian production features a talented cast including Zachary Bennett, Stephanie Moore, Michael Riley, and Martin Roach. With an average rating of 5.7, "Cube Zero" generated an impressive revenue of 232.3 million dollars upon its release on the 15th of October 2004.

title = Moneyball 
overview = The story of Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to put together a baseball team on a budget, by employing computer-generated analysis to draft his players. 
Director = Bennett Miller 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Bennett Miller 

In "Moneyball," directed by Bennett Miller, audiences are taken on a thrilling journey into the world of baseball through the eyes of Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beane. Faced with financial constraints, Beane revolutionizes the game by utilizing computer-generated analysis to assemble a competitive team. As he challenges the traditional norms of the sport, Beane's innovative approach not only defies expectations but also showcases the power of data-driven decision-making in the realm of professional sports. The film portrays Beane's successful attempt to put together a baseball team on a budget, highlighting his strategic use of statistical analysis to draft players and compete against wealthier teams. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct! the fact is indeed: [cast = brad pitt, jonah hill, philip seymour hoffman, robin wright]']

As he challenges the traditional norms of the sport, Beane's innovative approach not only defies expectations but also showcases the power of data-driven decision-making in the realm of professional sports. title = Allied 
overview = In 1942, an intelligence officer in North Africa encounters a female French Resistance fighter on a deadly mission behind enemy lines. When they reunite in London, their relationship is tested by the pressures of war. 
cast = Brad Pitt, Marion Cotillard, Jared Harris, Simon McBurney 
date of release = the 17 of November 2016 
revenue = 119.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!the description mentions the following facts:1. the film is called "allied".2. it was released on november 17th, 2016.3. brad pitt plays the role of an intelligence officer in north africa.4. marion cotillard plays the role of a brave female french resistance fighter.5. jared harris and simon mcburney are part of the supporting cast.6. the film grossed $119.5 million at the box office.all of these facts match the provided cast information, making it correct!']
fact : cast = Brad Pitt, Marion Cotillard, Jared Harris, Simon McBurney 

In the thrilling film "Allied," released on the 17th of November 2016, audiences are transported back to 1942 where an intelligence officer in North Africa, played by Brad Pitt, crosses paths with a brave female French Resistance fighter, portrayed by Marion Cotillard, on a dangerous mission deep within enemy territory. As their paths intertwine once again in London, their bond is put to the ultimate test amidst the tumultuous backdrop of war. With a stellar supporting cast including Jared Harris and Simon McBurney, "Allied" captivated viewers worldwide and grossed an impressive $119.5 million at the box office.

In the thrilling film "Allied," released on the 17th of November 2016, audiences are transported back to 1942 where an intelligence officer in North Africa, played by Brad Pitt, crosses paths with a brave female French Resistance fighter, portrayed by Marion Cotillard, on a dangerous mission deep within enemy territory. As their paths intertwine once again in London, their bond is put to the ultimate test amidst the tumultuous backdrop of war. With a stellar supporting cast including Jared Harris and Simon McBurney, "Allied" captivated viewers worldwide and grossed an impressive $119.5 million at the box office.

In "Death Wish 5: The Face of Death," Paul Kersey returns to his vigilante ways when his fiancée, Olivia, faces threats from mobsters. Set in Canada, this action-packed film directed by Allan A. Goldstein follows Kersey as he takes justice into his own hands. With a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, the movie was released on January 14, 1994. Starring Charles Bronson, Lesley-Anne Down, Michael Parks, and Chuck Shamata, the film has an average rating of 5.0. Produced by Damian Lee under the 21st Century Film Corporation, the movie had a budget of $5.0 million and grossed $1.7 million. With the tagline "No judge. No jury. No appeals. No deals," "Death Wish 5: The Face of Death" delivers intense action and suspense in the English language.

title = Maniac Cop 
overview = In New York, people are slain and strangled to death brutally on the open street. All witnesses agree that the murderer was in a cop's uniform. Soon the police searches and finds a suspect in its own ranks: Jack Forrest, turned in by his own wife. To prove his innocence, he has to investigate on his own. 
cast = Tom Atkins, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Richard Roundtree 
date of release = the 13 of May 1988 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description mentions the following cast members:1. tom atkins2. bruce campbell3. laurene landon4. richard roundtreeall four actors are correctly listed as part of the cast in the description for the movie "maniac cop".']
fact : cast = Tom Atkins, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Richard Roundtree 

In the gritty streets of New York City, a series of brutal murders shock the city as victims are slain and strangled in broad daylight by a mysterious figure donning a police uniform. The city is in a state of fear and paranoia as all witnesses point to one chilling fact - the killer is a cop. When Jack Forrest, a dedicated officer, is accused by his own wife and arrested as the prime suspect, he must embark on a dangerous journey to clear his name and find the true culprit. With the help of a few trusted allies, including the seasoned Tom Atkins, the charismatic Bruce Campbell, the fierce Laurene Landon, and the legendary Richard Roundtree, Jack delves into the dark underbelly of the police force to uncover the shocking truth. Released on the ominous date of May 13, 1988, "Maniac Cop" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = The Italian Job 
overview = Charlie's got a 'job' to do. Having just left prison he finds one his of friends has attempted a high risk job in Torino, Italy, right under the nose of the mafia. Charlie's friend doesn't get very far, so Charlie takes over the 'job'. Using three Mini Coopers, a couple of Jaguars and a bus, he hopes to bring Torino to a standstill, steal a fortune in gold and escape in the chaos.

In "The Italian Job," Charlie, a recently released ex-convict, steps in to complete a high-stakes heist in Torino, Italy after his friend's failed attempt. With a plan involving three Mini Coopers, Jaguars, and a bus, Charlie aims to outwit the mafia, bring the city to a halt, steal a fortune in gold, and escape in the chaos.

overview = The events of the war in 1944, from the Blue Hills to Sõrve Peninsula. Shown through the eyes of Estonian soldiers who had to pick sides and fight against fellow brothers. Choices have to be made, not only by the soldiers, but also by their loved ones.

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct: estonia was the production country of the film "1944".']
fact : production countrie = Estonia 

In the 2015 Estonian film "1944," directed by Elmo Nüganen and produced by Ilkka Matila of Matila Röhr Productions (MRP), viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the events of the war in 1944, specifically focusing on the Blue Hills to Sõrve Peninsula. The story unfolds through the eyes of Estonian soldiers who are faced with the challenging task of choosing sides and fighting against their own brothers in arms. As the conflict escalates, not only do the soldiers have to make difficult decisions, but their loved ones are also forced to confront their own choices. Released on the 20th of February 2015, this film delves into the harsh realities of war, highlighting the sacrifices and moral dilemmas that arise in times of conflict. With a stellar cast including Kristjan Üksküla, Kaspar Velberg, Märt Pius, and Priit Pius, "1944" is a poignant portrayal of the devastating impact of war on individuals and communities. The tagline "The first casualty of war is truth" sets the tone for this thought-provoking and emotionally charged movie, which garnered an average rating of 6.8. Despite its modest budget of 2.0 million dollars, "1944" managed to achieve a remarkable revenue of 60.2 million dollars, solidifying its success both critically and commercially. The original language of the movie is Estonian, and it has a duration of 1h40.

title = Submarine Command 
overview = Submarine commander Ken White is forced to suddenly submerge, leaving his captain and another crew member to die outside the sub during WW II. Subsequent years of meaningless navy ground assignments and the animosity of a former sailor, leave White (now a captain) feeling guilty and empty. His life spirals downward and his wife is about to leave him. Suddenly, he is forced into a dangerous rescue situation at the start of the Koren War.... reassigned to the same submarine where all of his problems began. 
average note = 5.3 
cast = William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix, Don Taylor 
tagline = Drama War 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = John Farrow 
budget = 284.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Joseph Sistrom 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
date of release = the 18 of January 1952 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['the fact is: [average note = 5.3]and... i found it!']
fact : average note = 5.3 

In "Submarine Command," directed by John Farrow, submarine commander Ken White faces a harrowing decision during WWII that haunts him for years. Forced to submerge suddenly, he must leave his captain and another crew member behind to die outside the sub. The guilt and emptiness from this event follow White, now a captain himself, through meaningless navy assignments and strained relationships. As his life unravels, a dangerous rescue mission at the onset of the Korean War brings him back to the same submarine where it all began. Starring William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix, and Don Taylor, this drama war film delves into the complexities of duty, guilt, and redemption. With a budget of 284.0 million dollars, "Submarine Command" was released on the 18th of January 1952 in the United States of America, receiving an average rating of 5.3.

The tagline for the movie is Drama War. The production country is the United States of America. The producer of the film is Joseph Sistrom. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 27 minutes.

In "Submarine Command," directed by John Farrow, submarine commander Ken White faces a harrowing decision during WWII that haunts him for years. Forced to submerge suddenly, he must leave his captain and another crew member behind to die outside the sub. The guilt and emptiness from this event follow White, now a captain himself, through meaningless navy assignments and strained relationships. As his life unravels, a dangerous rescue mission at the onset of the Korean War brings him back to the same submarine where it all began. Starring William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix, and Don Taylor, this drama war film delves into the complexities of duty, guilt, and redemption. With a budget of 284.0 million dollars, "Submarine Command" was released on the 18th of January 1952 in the United States of America, receiving an average rating of 5.3.

The tagline for the movie is Drama War. The production country is the United States of America. The producer of the film is Joseph Sistrom. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 27 minutes.

title = Warrior of the Lost World 
overview = A nomad mercenary on a high-tech motorcycle helps bring about the downfall of the evil Orwellian government, the Omega. 

In "Warrior of the Lost World," a nomad mercenary roars into action on his high-tech motorcycle, ready to take down the oppressive Orwellian government known as Omega. With his unmatched skills and determination, he becomes the beacon of hope for the oppressed citizens. As he navigates through a dystopian landscape filled with danger and deceit, he must use all his cunning and strength to bring about the downfall of the tyrannical regime. Will he succeed in his mission to liberate the people and restore freedom to the world? Join the warrior on his thrilling journey as he fights for justice and battles against all odds.

In the sultry thriller "Original Sin," a young man finds himself entangled in a web of deception and false identities as he chases after a captivating femme fatale, whose affections remain elusive. In the sultry thriller "Original Sin," a young man finds himself entangled in a web of deception and false identities as he chases after a captivating femme fatale, whose affections remain elusive. Directed by Michael Cristofer and produced by Intermedia Films, this gripping tale of love and betrayal unfolds against the backdrop of France. Released on the 3rd of August 2001, this film delves into the dark depths of desire and duplicity, where nothing is as it seems. The production company behind "Original Sin" is Intermedia Films. The movie was released on the 3rd of August 2001. The director of the film is Michael Cristofer. The production country of the film is France. 
 
 

 
title = Fading of the Cries 
overview = Jacob, a young man armed with a deadly sword, saves Sarah, a teenage girl, from Mathias, a malevolent evil that has begun plaguing a small farmland town while in search of an ancient necklace that had belonged to Sarahs Uncle. Jacob sets out to get Sarah home safely, running through streets, fields, churches and underground tunnels, while being pursued by hordes of demonic creatures. Along the way, both come to terms with the demons within themselves - Sarah begins to understand her hatred towards her mother and sister may be unjustified and Jacob discovers the secrets of his past, realizing the only way to truly defeat the demons is to return to the very place his family was murdered.

production countrie = United States of America

In "Fading of the Cries," directed by Steven Maguire, a young man named Jacob wields a deadly sword as he embarks on a mission to save Sarah, a teenage girl, from the malevolent evil entity, Mathias. Their journey through a small farmland town in search of an ancient necklace leads them through streets, fields, churches, and underground tunnels, all while being relentlessly pursued by hordes of demonic creatures. As they navigate the dangers around them, both Jacob and Sarah confront their inner demons - Sarah questioning her feelings towards her family, and Jacob uncovering the dark secrets of his past. To truly defeat the evil forces, Jacob must confront the ghosts of his family's tragic past. Starring Jordan Matthews, Thomas Ian Nicholas, Brad Dourif, and Mackenzie Rosman, this supernatural thriller unfolds in English, with a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes. Released on July 8, 2011, "Fading of the Cries" generated a revenue of 140.3 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 0.5 million dollars. The tagline "The journey home is just the beginning" encapsulates the harrowing and transformative odyssey that awaits the characters in this gripping tale. The production company behind the film is also named "Fading of the Cries," and the producer of the movie is Karoline Kautz. The film was produced in the United States of America.

title = No Way Out 
overview = Navy Lt. Tom Farrell meets a young woman, Susan Atwell , and they share a passionate fling. Farrell then finds out that his superior, Defense Secretary David Brice, is also romantically involved with Atwell. When the young woman turns up dead, Farrell is put in charge of the murder investigation. He begins to uncover shocking clues about the case, but when details of his encounter with Susan surface, he becomes a suspect as well. 
production compagnie = Orion Pictures 
Director = Roger Donaldson 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 35.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
Producer = Robert Garland 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct. according to the description, the production company behind the film "no way out" is indeed orion pictures.']
fact : production compagnie = Orion Pictures 

In the suspenseful thriller "No Way Out," Navy Lt. Tom Farrell finds himself entangled in a web of deceit and danger after a passionate affair with Susan Atwell, who is also involved with his superior, Defense Secretary David Brice. When Atwell is found dead, Farrell is tasked with investigating her murder, only to uncover shocking revelations that implicate high-ranking officials. As he delves deeper into the case, his own past with Atwell comes back to haunt him, turning him into a prime suspect. Directed by Roger Donaldson and produced by Robert Garland, this gripping film, produced by Orion Pictures, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 54 minutes. With a budget of $15.0 million and a revenue of $35.5 million, "No Way Out" proves to be a captivating and financially successful thriller. The original language of the movie is English.

Tom Farrell finds himself entangled in a web of deceit and danger after a passionate affair with Susan Atwell, who is also involved with his superior, Defense Secretary David Brice. When Atwell is found dead, Farrell is tasked with investigating her murder, only to uncover shocking revelations that implicate high-ranking officials. As he delves deeper into the case, his own past with Atwell comes back to haunt him, turning him into a prime suspect. Directed by Roger Donaldson and produced by Robert Garland, this gripping film, produced by Orion Pictures, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 54 minutes. With a budget of $15.0 million and a revenue of $35.5 million, "No Way Out" proves to be a captivating and financially successful thriller. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Kramer vs. Kramer 
overview = Ted Kramer is a career man for whom his work comes before his family. His wife Joanna cannot take this anymore, so she decides to leave him. Ted is now faced with the tasks of housekeeping and taking care of himself and their young son Billy.

average note = 7.4

['correct! the fact "revenue = 106.3 millions of dollars" is indeed mentioned in the description as part of the box office grossing data for the film "kramer vs. kramer".']
fact : revenue = 106.3 millions of dollars 

In the 1979 American drama film "Kramer vs. Kramer," directed by Robert Benton and produced by Stanley R. Jaffe under the production company Columbia Pictures, we witness the story of Ted Kramer, a career-focused man whose priorities are shaken when his wife Joanna, portrayed by Meryl Streep, decides to leave him, leaving him to take care of their young son Billy, played by Justin Henry. Starring alongside them are Dustin Hoffman and Jane Alexander. This emotional journey explores the complexities of love and family. With a budget of 8.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross 106.3 million dollars at the box office. Released on the 18th of December 1979, in English, the movie received an average rating of 7.4. Running for 1 hour and 45 minutes, the tagline of the movie reminds us that there are three sides to every love story.

title = Invaders from Mars 
overview = In this remake of the classic 50s SF tale, a boy tries to stop an invasion of his town by aliens who take over the the minds of his parents, his least-liked schoolteacher and other townspeople. With the aid of the school nurse the boy enlists the aid of the U.S. Marines. 
budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tobe Hooper 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Menahem Golan 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 5.5 
date of release = the 1 of January 1986 
production compagnie = Cannon Pictures 
tagline = Their conquest has already begun... He know they're here. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description states that the budget for the movie "invaders from mars" is $12 million, which matches the fact.']
fact : budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 

In the 1986 science fiction film "Invaders from Mars," directed by Tobe Hooper and produced by Menahem Golan, a young boy discovers that aliens have invaded his town, controlling the minds of his parents, his schoolteacher, and other residents. Desperate to stop the invasion, he teams up with the school nurse and enlists the help of the U.S. Marines. Set in the United States of America, the movie, with a budget of 12 million dollars, unfolds as a thrilling remake of a classic 50s SF tale. As the boy uncovers the sinister plot, the tension rises, leading to a climactic showdown with the extraterrestrial invaders. With an average rating of 5.5, this English-language film by Cannon Pictures captivates audiences with its tagline: "Their conquest has already begun... He knows they're here."

The movie was released on the 1st of January 1986.

In the 1986 science fiction film "Invaders from Mars," directed by Tobe Hooper and produced by Menahem Golan, a young boy discovers that aliens have invaded his town, controlling the minds of his parents, his schoolteacher, and other residents. Desperate to stop the invasion, he teams up with the school nurse and enlists the help of the U.S. Marines. Set in the United States of America, the movie, with a budget of 12 million dollars, unfolds as a thrilling remake of a classic 50s SF tale. As the boy uncovers the sinister plot, the tension rises, leading to a climactic showdown with the extraterrestrial invaders. With an average rating of 5.5, this English-language film by Cannon Pictures captivates audiences with its tagline: "Their conquest has already begun... He knows they're here."

The movie was released on the 1st of January 1986.

fact : Director = Seth Holt 

In the 1958 film "Nowhere to Go," directed by Seth Holt, a professional thief is unexpectedly released from prison with the help of a new partner who is determined to uncover the whereabouts of his hidden loot. As they navigate through a web of deception and betrayal, the thief finds himself torn between loyalty and self-preservation. With a runtime of 1 hour and 29 minutes, this gripping crime thriller delves into the complexities of trust and greed. The tagline teases, "...except into a woman's arms!" Despite its modest budget of 12.5 million dollars, the film managed to rake in an impressive revenue of 112.5 million dollars, proving to be a success both critically and commercially with an average rating of 6.4. The movie was released on the 2nd of December 1958.

title = The Crimson Rivers 
overview = Two French policemen, one investigating a grisly murder at a remote mountain college, the other working on the desecration of a young girl's grave by skinheads, are brought together by the clues from their respective cases. Soon after they start working together, more murders are committed, and the pair begin to discover just what dark secrets are behind the killings. 
production compagnie = Gaumont International 
revenue = 180.1 millions of dollars 
cast = Jean Reno, Vincent Cassel, Nadia Farès, Dominique Sanda 
date of release = the 26 of September 2000 
average note = 6.8 
production countrie = France 
Producer = Alain Goldman 
tagline = Evil rises to new heights. 
original language of the movie = French 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!the description accurately states that:* the production company behind the film is indeed gaumont international.* the film was produced by alain goldman.so, the fact is correct!']
fact : production compagnie = Gaumont International 

In the intense thriller "The Crimson Rivers," produced by Gaumont International and released on the 26th of September 2000, two French policemen, portrayed by the talented Jean Reno and Vincent Cassel, find themselves entangled in a web of gruesome murders and dark secrets. Investigating a murder at a remote mountain college and the desecration of a young girl's grave by skinheads, they join forces as more killings occur, leading them to uncover sinister truths. With a stellar cast including Nadia Farès and Dominique Sanda, this French-language film delves into the depths of evil as the average note of 6.8 reflects its gripping storyline. As evil rises to new heights, "The Crimson Rivers" captivates audiences and rakes in a revenue of 180.1 million dollars, solidifying its place as a must-watch thriller. The production company behind this gripping film is Gaumont International, and it was produced by Alain Goldman. The movie was primarily filmed in France, and the original language of the movie is French. The tagline for the film is "Evil rises to new heights."

title = The Square 
overview = The Square, a new film by Jehane Noujaim (Control Room; Rafea: Solar Mama), looks at the hard realities faced day-to-day by people working to build Egypt’s new democracy. Catapulting us into the action spread across 2011 and 2012, the film provides a kaleidoscopic, visceral experience of the struggle. Cairo’s Tahrir Square is the heart and soul of the film, which follows several young activists. Armed with values, determination, music, humor, an abundance of social media, and sheer obstinacy, they know that the thorny path to democracy only began with Hosni Mubarek’s fall. The life-and-death struggle between the people and the power of the state is still playing out. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
revenue = 246.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Arabic 
production compagnie = Roast Beef Productions 
budget = 235.3 millions of dollars 
Director = Jehane Noujaim 
tagline = What does it mean to risk your life for your ideals? How far will five revolutionaries go in defending their beliefs in the fight for their nation? 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
average note = 7.8 
Producer = Maxyne Franklin 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. according to the description, the production country is indeed the united kingdom.']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In "The Square," directed by Jehane Noujaim, viewers are immersed in the tumultuous journey of young activists in Egypt striving to establish a new democracy. Set against the backdrop of Cairo's Tahrir Square during the pivotal years of 2011 and 2012, the film offers a raw and dynamic portrayal of their unwavering determination and resilience. Fueled by values, humor, music, and a relentless spirit, these individuals navigate the complexities of post-revolution Egypt, where the struggle between the people and the state's power continues to unfold. With a production company like Roast Beef Productions and a budget of 235.3 million dollars, this gripping narrative unfolds in Arabic, the original language of the movie. The tagline "What does it mean to risk your life for your ideals? How far will five revolutionaries go in defending their beliefs in the fight for their nation?" encapsulates the central themes explored in this 1 hour and 28-minute film. Despite its critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.8, the movie also achieved significant commercial success, grossing 246.2 million dollars at the box office. Produced by Maxyne Franklin and originating from the United Kingdom, "The Square" is a compelling and thought-provoking cinematic experience that delves into the complexities of democracy and activism.

In "The Square," directed by Jehane Noujaim, viewers are immersed in the tumultuous journey of young activists in Egypt striving to establish a new democracy. Set against the backdrop of Cairo's Tahrir Square during the pivotal years of 2011 and 2012, the film offers a raw and dynamic portrayal of their unwavering determination and resilience. Fueled by values, humor, music, and a relentless spirit, these individuals navigate the complexities of post-revolution Egypt, where the struggle between the people and the state's power continues to unfold. With a production company like Roast Beef Productions and a budget of 235.3 million dollars, this gripping narrative unfolds in Arabic, the original language of the movie. The tagline "What does it mean to risk your life for your ideals? How far will five revolutionaries go in defending their beliefs in the fight for their nation?" encapsulates the central themes explored in this 1 hour and 28-minute film. Despite its critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.8, the movie also achieved significant commercial success, grossing 246.2 million dollars at the box office. Produced by Maxyne Franklin and originating from the United Kingdom, "The Square" is a compelling and thought-provoking cinematic experience that delves into the complexities of democracy and activism.

title = King Arthur 
overview = The story of the Arthurian legend, based on the 'Sarmatian hypothesis' which contends that the legend has a historical nucleus in the Sarmatian heavy cavalry troops stationed in Britain, and that the Roman-British military commander, Lucius Artorius Castus is the historical person behind the legend. 
date of release = the 7 of July 2004 
Director = Antoine Fuqua 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 203.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Jerry Bruckheimer Films 
production countrie = Ireland 
average note = 6.1 
tagline = Rule Your Fate. 
duration of the movie = 2h06 
Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. according to the description, the date of release for the movie "king arthur" is indeed july 7th, 2004.']
fact : date of release = the 7 of July 2004 

In the epic movie "King Arthur," director Antoine Fuqua brings to life the Arthurian legend in a unique way. Released on the 7th of July 2004, the film explores the 'Sarmatian hypothesis,' suggesting a historical basis for the legend involving Sarmatian cavalry troops in Britain. The story follows Roman-British military commander Lucius Artorius Castus, believed to be the real figure behind the mythical King Arthur. Produced by Jerry Bruckheimer Films in Ireland, the movie grossed an impressive $203.6 million in revenue. With an average rating of 6.1, the film is presented in its original English language, captivating audiences with a runtime of 2 hours and 6 minutes. As you watch "King Arthur," remember its tagline: "Rule Your Fate." The movie was produced by Jerry Bruckheimer.

title = La Luna 
overview = While touring in Italy, a recently-widowed American opera singer has an incestuous relationship with her 15-year-old son to help him overcome his heroin addiction. 
budget = 293.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Giovanni Bertolucci 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the fact that [budget = 293.9 millions of dollars] is indeed mentioned in the description of the film "la luna".']
fact : budget = 293.9 millions of dollars 

title = La Luna 
overview = While touring in Italy, a recently-widowed American opera singer has an incestuous relationship with her 15-year-old son to help him overcome his heroin addiction. 
budget = 293.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Giovanni Bertolucci 

In "La Luna," a gripping drama unfolds as a recently-widowed American opera singer finds herself entangled in a controversial and taboo relationship with her 15-year-old son while on tour in Italy. As she grapples with her own grief and his heroin addiction, their bond takes on a disturbing and complex nature. Produced by Giovanni Bertolucci, this film delves into the darkest corners of human relationships and the lengths one will go to in order to save a loved one. With a budget of 293.9 million dollars, "La Luna" is a haunting exploration of love, loss, and the blurred lines between devotion and destruction.

As she grapples with her own grief and his heroin addiction, their bond takes on a disturbing and complex nature. Produced by Giovanni Bertolucci, this film delves into the darkest corners of human relationships and the lengths one will go to in order to save a loved one. With a budget of 293.9 million dollars, "La Luna" is a haunting exploration of love, loss, and the blurred lines between devotion and destruction.

When Anna Reilly, once their childhood friend and now grown into a beautiful corporate executive, suddenly returns to the city, she reenters Jake and Brian's lives and hearts with a vengeance. Sparks fly and an unusual and complicated love triangle ensues.

title = My Scientology Movie 
overview = Following a long fascination with the religion and with much experience in dealing with eccentric, unpalatable and unexpected human behavior, the beguilingly unassuming Theroux won't take no for an answer when his request to enter the Church's headquarters is turned down. Inspired by the Church's use of filming techniques, and aided by ex-members of the organization, Theroux uses actors to replay some incidents people claim they experienced as members in an attempt to better understand the way it operates. In a bizarre twist, it becomes clear that the Church is also making a film about Louis Theroux. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 5 of May 2016 
production compagnie = BBC Films 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the fact that the movie "my scientology movie" is in the original language of english is stated in the description.']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "My Scientology Movie," released on the 5th of May 2016, acclaimed documentarian Louis Theroux embarks on a captivating exploration of the secretive religion of Scientology. Despite facing rejection when attempting to enter the Church's headquarters, Theroux persists in his quest for understanding. Drawing inspiration from the Church's own filming techniques, he enlists the help of former members to recreate alleged experiences within the organization. As the project unfolds, a startling revelation emerges - the Church is simultaneously creating a film about Louis Theroux himself. Produced by BBC Films, this English-language documentary delves into the enigmatic world of Scientology through a unique and thought-provoking lens.

title = Night Shift 
overview = A nebbish of a morgue attendant gets shunted back to the night shift where he is shackled with an obnoxious neophyte partner who dreams of the "one great idea" for success. His life takes a bizarre turn when a prostitute neighbour complains about the loss of her pimp. His partner, upon hearing the situation, suggests that they fill that opening themselves using the morgue at night . 
date of release = the 30 of July 1982 
tagline = Ever since two enterprising young men turned the City Morgue into a swinging business, people have been dying to get in. 
Producer = Brian Grazer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: **correct**the description contains the following facts:* title: night shift ( correct )* overview of the movie ( correct )* date of release: july 30th, 1982 ( correct )* tagline: [actually, the tagline mentioned in the description is "a wild ride", not "ever since two enterprising young men turned the city morgue into a swinging business, people have been dying to get in"]* producer: brian grazer ( correct )']
fact : date of release = the 30 of July 1982 

In the dark comedy "Night Shift," released on the 30th of July 1982, a timid morgue attendant finds himself back on the night shift with a loud and ambitious new partner. When a prostitute neighbor seeks their help after losing her pimp, the duo comes up with a bizarre idea to fill the void themselves - using the morgue at night. As they embark on this unconventional venture, they discover that success and chaos go hand in hand. Produced by Brian Grazer, this film explores the unexpected twists and turns that come with chasing the "one great idea" for success, all while navigating the strange world of the night shift. With a tagline that promises a wild ride, "Night Shift" showcases how one decision can change everything in the most unexpected ways.

- Title: Night Shift
- Overview of the movie
- Date of release: the 30th of July 1982
- Tagline: Ever since two enterprising young men turned the City Morgue into a swinging business, people have been dying to get in
- Producer: Brian Grazer

In the dark comedy "Night Shift," released on the 30th of July 1982, a timid morgue attendant finds himself back on the night shift with a loud and ambitious new partner. When a prostitute neighbor seeks their help after losing her pimp, the duo comes up with a bizarre idea to fill the void themselves - using the morgue at night. As they embark on this unconventional venture, they discover that success and chaos go hand in hand. Produced by Brian Grazer, this film explores the unexpected twists and turns that come with chasing the "one great idea" for success, all while navigating the strange world of the night shift. With a tagline that promises a wild ride, "Night Shift" showcases how one decision can change everything in the most unexpected ways.

title = The Brown Bunny 
overview = Bud Clay races motorcycles in the 250cc Formula II class of road racing. After a race in New Hampshire, he has five days to get to his next race in California. During his road trip, he is haunted by memories of the last time he saw Daisy, his true love. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct.the description mentions the cast members: vincent gallo, chloë sevigny, cheryl tiegs, elizabeth blake.']
fact : cast = Vincent Gallo, Chloë Sevigny, Cheryl Tiegs, Elizabeth Blake 

In "The Brown Bunny," we follow Bud Clay, a skilled motorcycle racer competing in the 250cc Formula II class. After a race in New Hampshire, Bud embarks on a journey to California for his next race, with only five days to spare. As he travels, he is consumed by memories of Daisy, his lost love, making his road trip a poignant and introspective exploration of love and loss. Bud's emotional turmoil and introspection are visually captured in long, contemplative scenes that immerse the audience in his journey both physically and emotionally. The film is known for its controversial explicit content, including a highly debated graphic scene between Bud and Daisy, played by Chloë Sevigny. The Brown Bunny gained notoriety for its polarizing reception at the Cannes Film Festival, where it sparked both criticism and praise for its unconventional storytelling and visual style.

As he travels, he is consumed by memories of Daisy, his lost love, making his road trip a poignant and introspective exploration of love and loss. Bud's emotional turmoil and introspection are visually captured in long, contemplative scenes that immerse the audience in his journey both physically and emotionally. The film is known for its controversial explicit content, including a highly debated graphic scene between Bud and Daisy, played by Chloë Sevigny. The Brown Bunny gained notoriety for its polarizing reception at the Cannes Film Festival, where it sparked both criticism and praise for its unconventional storytelling and visual style. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong. there is no mention of the duration of the movie being 1h33 in the description.']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In "The Brown Bunny," we follow Bud Clay, a skilled motorcycle racer competing in the 250cc Formula II class. After a race in New Hampshire, Bud embarks on a journey to California for his next race, with only five days to spare. As he travels, he is consumed by memories of Daisy, his lost love, making his road trip a poignant and introspective exploration of love and loss. Bud's emotional turmoil and introspection are visually captured in long, contemplative scenes that immerse the audience in his journey both physically and emotionally. title = Zombie Holocaust 
overview = The members of an expedition in search for the last faithful of Kito, the cannibal god, land on a small island in the Moluccas (East Indies). They are soon hunted by cannibals and zombies created by the sinister Doctor O'Brien, who is experimenting with both corpses and living humans. Susan, a sexy lady in the expedition team, eventually gets the upper hand. She gains acceptance with the natives as queen of the cannibals and directs them against the mad scientist with his army of zombies. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong. the average note is not mentioned in the description.']
fact : average note = 5.6 

In "Zombie Holocaust," a group of explorers embarks on a perilous journey to uncover the mysteries surrounding the cannibal god Kito. Landing on a remote island in the East Indies, they quickly find themselves ensnared in a deadly game of survival as they are pursued by both cannibals and zombies. The sinister Doctor O'Brien, who is experimenting with corpses and living humans, lurks in the shadows, conducting gruesome experiments. Amidst the chaos, Susan, a bold and alluring member of the expedition, rises to the occasion. As she gains acceptance with the natives as queen of the cannibals, she leads them in a fierce battle against the mad scientist and his army of the undead. Will Susan's cunning and bravery be enough to overcome the horrors that await on the island, or will they all fall victim to the madness unleashed by Doctor O'Brien?

title = Leadbelly 
overview = The life of Blues and folk singer Huddie Leadbetter, nicknamed Leadbelly is recounted. Covering the good times and bad from his 20s to 40s. Much of that time was spent on chain gangs in the south. Even in prison he became well known for the songs he had composed and sung during and before the time he spent there. 
production compagnie = Brownstone Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description mentions that "in \'leadbelly,\' produced by brownstone productions...", which matches the fact you provided: [production compagnie = brownstone productions].']
fact : production compagnie = Brownstone Productions 

title = Leadbelly 
overview = The life of Blues and folk singer Huddie Leadbetter, nicknamed Leadbelly is recounted. Covering the good times and bad from his 20s to 40s. Much of that time was spent on chain gangs in the south. Even in prison he became well known for the songs he had composed and sung during and before the time he spent there. 
production compagnie = Brownstone Productions 

In "Leadbelly," produced by Brownstone Productions, viewers are taken on a journey through the tumultuous life of Huddie Leadbetter, better known as Leadbelly. From his twenties to his forties, Leadbelly's life is a rollercoaster of highs and lows, with a significant portion of his time spent on chain gangs in the South. Despite his time behind bars, Leadbelly's musical talent shines through as he becomes renowned for the songs he composed and performed, both during his incarceration and before. This biographical film captures the essence of a man whose music transcended the confines of his circumstances, leaving a lasting impact on the world.

In "Leadbelly," produced by Brownstone Productions, viewers are taken on a journey through the tumultuous life of Huddie Leadbetter, better known as Leadbelly. From his twenties to his forties, Leadbelly's life is a rollercoaster of highs and lows, with a significant portion of his time spent on chain gangs in the South. Despite his time behind bars, Leadbelly's musical talent shines through as he becomes renowned for the songs he composed and performed, both during his incarceration and before. This biographical film captures the essence of a man whose music transcended the confines of his circumstances, leaving a lasting impact on the world.

overview = With the nation of Panem in a full scale war, Katniss confronts President Snow in the final showdown. Teamed with a group of her closest friends – including Gale, Finnick, and Peeta – Katniss goes off on a mission with the unit from District 13 as they risk their lives to stage an assassination attempt on President Snow who has become increasingly obsessed with destroying her. The mortal traps, enemies, and moral choices that await Katniss will challenge her more than any arena she faced in The Hunger Games.

title = Deathsport 
overview = 1000 years into the future, after the Great Neutron Wars, the world is divided into desert wastelands and isolated city-states. Notorious "Desert Ranger" Kaz is forced to fight in the DeathSport, dueling on futuristic motorcycle "Death Machines". With the help of renegade vixen Deneer, Kaz must face his past and fight to save himself and his people. 
tagline = DeathSport isn't just a game. In the year 3000, it's the only way to survive! 
average note = 4.6 
revenue = 266.9 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English

["correct!the description indeed includes the fact: [tagline = deathsport isn't just a game. in the year 3000, it's the only way to survive!]"]
fact : tagline = DeathSport isn't just a game. In the year 3000, it's the only way to survive! 

In the distant future, 1000 years after the Great Neutron Wars, the world is a harsh landscape of desert wastelands and fortified city-states. In this unforgiving world, the infamous "Desert Ranger" Kaz finds himself unwillingly thrust into the brutal DeathSport arena, where participants engage in deadly duels on futuristic motorcycle "Death Machines". As Kaz navigates this treacherous world of violence and survival, he forms an unlikely alliance with the rebellious Deneer, a fierce warrior determined to challenge the oppressive system. Together, they confront Kaz's haunted past and embark on a dangerous journey to not only save themselves but also their people. With a thrilling tagline proclaiming "DeathSport isn't just a game. In the year 3000, it's the only way to survive!", this action-packed film in its original English language captivates audiences with its adrenaline-pumping battles and dystopian setting. With an impressive revenue of 266.9 million dollars and an average note of 4.6, "Deathsport" promises a gripping cinematic experience that will leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = The Young Victoria 
overview = From Academy Award® winners Graham King and Martin Scorsese, along with the makers of Gosford Park and The Departed, comes the story of Queen Victoria’s early rise to power. From an object of a royal power-struggle to her romantic courtship and legendary marriage to Prince Albert, Emily Blunt (The Devil Wears Prada) gives a stunning performance as the young Victoria. Packed with drama, romance, breath-taking cinematography, lavish costumes and featuring an outstanding British cast including Jim Broadbent, Harriet Walter, Mark Strong, Paul Bettany, Miranda Richardson, and Rupert Friend, The Young Victoria has captivated British audiences, and is the film that Company magazine called “an epic British film, which will sweep you up in her remarkable story.” 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
budget = 35.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 27.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Love rules all. 
Director = Jean-Marc Vallée 
Producer = Martin Scorsese 
average note = 7.1 
date of release = the 4 of March 2009 
production compagnie = GK Films 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the historical drama "The Young Victoria," directed by Jean-Marc Vallée and produced by Martin Scorsese, viewers are transported to the early rise of Queen Victoria to power in the United Kingdom. Emily Blunt delivers a stunning performance as the young Victoria, showcasing her journey from being the object of a royal power-struggle to her romantic courtship and legendary marriage to Prince Albert. Packed with drama, romance, and breathtaking cinematography, this film captures the lavish costumes and features an outstanding British cast including Jim Broadbent, Harriet Walter, Mark Strong, Paul Bettany, Miranda Richardson, and Rupert Friend. Despite facing a budget of 35.0 million dollars and generating a revenue of 27.4 million dollars, "The Young Victoria" received critical acclaim with an average note of 7.1. Released on the 4th of March 2009, this epic British film is a captivating portrayal of Queen Victoria's remarkable story, proving that love rules all. The production company behind the film is GK Films. The tagline for the movie is "Love rules all."

title = Ballplayer 
overview = Two top baseball prospects in the Dominican Republic face fierce competition and corruption as they chase their big league dreams. 
date of release = the 13 of July 2012 
average note = 5.9 
cast = Jean Carlos Batista, John Leguizamo, Miguel Angel Sano 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
Producer = Jonathan Paley 
duration of the movie = 1h17 
revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['the fact is: true']
fact : date of release = the 13 of July 2012 

In the gripping sports drama "Ballplayer," released on the 13th of July 2012, viewers are taken on a journey through the competitive and corrupt world of baseball prospects in the Dominican Republic. With an average rating of 5.9, the film follows two talented players, portrayed by Jean Carlos Batista and Miguel Angel Sano, as they navigate the challenges of pursuing their big league dreams. John Leguizamo also stars in this Spanish-language film produced by Jonathan Paley. With a runtime of 1 hour and 17 minutes, "Ballplayer" delves into the harsh realities of the baseball industry, where talent alone may not be enough to succeed. Despite a budget of 3.0 million dollars, the movie did not generate any revenue, highlighting the tough competition and high stakes involved in the pursuit of professional sports careers.

title = On Our Merry Way 
overview = Oliver Pease gets a dose of courage from his wife Martha and tricks the editor of the paper (where he writes lost pet notices) into assigning him the day's roving question. Martha suggests, "Has a little child ever changed your life?" Oliver gets answers from two slow-talking musicians, an actress whose roles usually feature a sarong, and an itinerant cardsharp. In each case the "little child" is hardly innocent: in the first, a local auto mechanic's "baby" turns out to be fully developed as a woman and a musician; in the second, a spoiled child star learns kindness; in the third, the family of a lost brat doesn't want him returned. And Oliver, what becomes of him? 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Burgess Meredith 
production compagnie = United Artists 
budget = 150.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the original language of the movie "on our merry way" is indeed english.']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the heartwarming film "On Our Merry Way," directed by Burgess Meredith and produced by United Artists, we follow the journey of Oliver Pease as he embarks on a quest to find stories about how little children have changed people's lives. With a budget of 150.4 million dollars, Oliver, a timid writer of lost pet notices, is encouraged by his wife Martha to seek out these tales of inspiration. Oliver tricks the editor of the paper into assigning him the day's roving question, "Has a little child ever changed your life?" Along the way, he encounters a variety of characters, including slow-talking musicians, a glamorous actress, and a cunning cardsharp. Each story Oliver uncovers reveals that the "little child" in question is far from innocent, leading to unexpected twists and turns. In the first story, a local auto mechanic's "baby" turns out to be fully developed as a woman and a musician. In the second story, a spoiled child star learns kindness. In the third story, the family of a lost brat doesn't want him returned. As Oliver delves deeper into these narratives, he also undergoes a transformation of his own. Will he find the courage to face his own challenges and discover the true meaning of life-changing moments? 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct.according to the description, the producer of "on our merry way" is indeed burgess meredith.']
fact : Producer = Burgess Meredith 

In the heartwarming film "On Our Merry Way," directed by Burgess Meredith and produced by United Artists, we follow the journey of Oliver Pease as he embarks on a quest to find stories about how little children have changed people's lives. With a budget of 150.4 million dollars, Oliver, a timid writer of lost pet notices, is encouraged by his wife Martha to seek out these tales of inspiration. Oliver tricks the editor of the paper into assigning him the day's roving question, "Has a little child ever changed your life?" Along the way, he encounters a variety of characters, including slow-talking musicians, a glamorous actress, and a cunning cardsharp. Each story Oliver uncovers reveals that the "little child" in question is far from innocent, leading to unexpected twists and turns. In the first story, a local auto mechanic's "baby" turns out to be fully developed as a woman and a musician. In the second story, a spoiled child star learns kindness. In the third story, the family of a lost brat doesn't want him returned. As Oliver delves deeper into these narratives, he also undergoes a transformation of his own. In the heartwarming film "On Our Merry Way," directed by Burgess Meredith and produced by United Artists, we follow the journey of Oliver Pease as he embarks on a quest to find stories about how little children have changed people's lives. With a budget of 150.4 million dollars, Oliver, a timid writer of lost pet notices, is encouraged by his wife Martha to seek out these tales of inspiration. Oliver tricks the editor of the paper into assigning him the day's roving question, "Has a little child ever changed your life?" Along the way, he encounters a variety of characters, including slow-talking musicians, a glamorous actress, and a cunning cardsharp. Each story Oliver uncovers reveals that the "little child" in question is far from innocent, leading to unexpected twists and turns. In the first story, a local auto mechanic's "baby" turns out to be fully developed as a woman and a musician. In the second story, a spoiled child star learns kindness. In the third story, the family of a lost brat doesn't want him returned. As Oliver delves deeper into these narratives, he also undergoes a transformation of his own. Will he find the courage to face his own challenges and discover the true meaning of life-changing moments?

title = A Holiday Engagement 
overview = Thirty-something Hillary Burns has spent her life trying to get the approval of her parents, most specifically her judgmental mother, Meredith Burns, thus far without success. Part of that approval for Hillary is to marry the right man. That's why Hillary is so happy that she is engaged to successful lawyer Jason King, who she will bring home to meet the family for the first time at their Thanksgiving get-together weekend in a week's time. However, Hillary's life starts to fall apart when simultaneously she loses her part-time newspaper writing job when the newspaper itself folds, and Jason dumps her as he tries to focus on his career which is seemingly more important to him than Hillary. On the advice of her best friend Sophie, Hillary - who feels she can't go home without Jason, especially as her two sisters' lives seem to meet their mother's approval - decides... 
budget = 87.1 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Bonnie Somerville, Shelley Long, Jordan Bridges, Sam McMurray

In "A Holiday Engagement," Hillary Burns, a thirty-something woman, is determined to win the approval of her critical mother by marrying the perfect man. When her engagement to successful lawyer Jason King falls apart, Hillary's world crumbles as she faces job loss and heartbreak. With Thanksgiving approaching, Hillary must find a solution to save face in front of her family. Starring Bonnie Somerville, Shelley Long, Jordan Bridges, and Sam McMurray, this heartwarming tale explores the complexities of family dynamics and the pursuit of happiness. Directed by Jim Fall and released on November 28, 2011, in the United States, this film garnered an average rating of 6.2. With a budget of 87.1 million dollars, "A Holiday Engagement" was produced by Johnson Production Group and went on to earn an impressive revenue of 225.4 million dollars, making it a holiday classic for audiences worldwide. The original language of the movie is English.

title = The Friends of Eddie Coyle 
overview = Eddie's friends are numerous, but the term friends is suspect. As a small time hood Eddie is about to go back to jail. In order to escape this fate he deals information on stolen guns to the feds. Simultaneously he is supplying arms to his bank robbing/kidnapping hoodlum chums. But who else is dealing with the feds? Who gets the blame for snitching on the bank robbers? 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
tagline = It's a grubby, violent, dangerous world. But it's the only world they know. And they're the only friends Eddie has. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the production company behind "the friends of eddie coyle" is indeed paramount pictures, as stated in the description.']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

The film "The Friends of Eddie Coyle" follows the story of Eddie, a small-time hood who is facing the prospect of returning to jail. To avoid this fate, Eddie decides to provide information on stolen guns to the authorities. However, he is also involved in supplying arms to his criminal associates who are engaged in bank robberies and kidnappings. The intricate web of deceit and conflicting loyalties leads to a tense atmosphere where the identity of the informant on the bank robbers becomes a central question. As tensions escalate and suspicions run high, the ultimate betrayal looms over Eddie and his associates.

Produced by Paramount Pictures, "The Friends of Eddie Coyle" delves into the gritty and perilous world of crime, where trust is a rare commodity and survival is paramount. The tagline, "It's a grubby, violent, dangerous world. But it's the only world they know. And they're the only friends Eddie has," encapsulates the harsh reality faced by Eddie and his acquaintances. In a world where alliances can shift in an instant and deception is a constant threat, Eddie must navigate carefully to protect himself and uncover the truth amidst a sea of lies.

The film "The Friends of Eddie Coyle" follows the story of Eddie, a small-time hood who is facing the prospect of returning to jail. To avoid this fate, Eddie decides to provide information on stolen guns to the authorities. However, he is also involved in supplying arms to his criminal associates who are engaged in bank robberies and kidnappings. The intricate web of deceit and conflicting loyalties leads to a tense atmosphere where the identity of the informant on the bank robbers becomes a central question. As tensions escalate and suspicions run high, the ultimate betrayal looms over Eddie and his associates.

Produced by Paramount Pictures, "The Friends of Eddie Coyle" delves into the gritty and perilous world of crime, where trust is a rare commodity and survival is paramount. The tagline, "It's a grubby, violent, dangerous world. But it's the only world they know. And they're the only friends Eddie has," encapsulates the harsh reality faced by Eddie and his acquaintances. In a world where alliances can shift in an instant and deception is a constant threat, Eddie must navigate carefully to protect himself and uncover the truth amidst a sea of lies.

title = Dolphin Tale 
overview = A story centered on the friendship between a boy and a dolphin whose tail was lost in a crab trap. 
production compagnie = Alcon Entertainment 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 95.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.6 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Morgan Freeman, Ashley Judd, Harry Connick Jr., Nathan Gamble 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is correct! according to the description, the production company responsible for the film "dolphin tale" is indeed alcon entertainment.']
fact : production compagnie = Alcon Entertainment 

In the heartwarming film "Dolphin Tale," produced by Alcon Entertainment, viewers are taken on a journey centered around the special bond between a young boy and a dolphin who loses its tail in a crab trap. Set in the United States of America and primarily spoken in English, this touching tale has captured the hearts of audiences worldwide. With a stellar cast including Morgan Freeman, Ashley Judd, Harry Connick Jr., and Nathan Gamble, the movie has grossed an impressive $95.4 million in revenue. Garnering an average rating of 6.6, "Dolphin Tale" is a must-watch for those seeking a touching story of friendship and resilience.

title = Ravenous 
overview = Upon receiving reports of missing persons at Fort Spencer, a remote Army outpost on the Western frontier, Capt. John Boyd investigates. After arriving at his new post, Boyd and his regiment aid a wounded frontiersman who recounts a horrifying tale of a wagon train murdered by its supposed guide -- a vicious U.S. Army colonel gone rogue. Fearing the worst, the regiment heads out into the wilderness to verify the gruesome claims 
Producer = Adam Fields 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 16 of March 1999 
revenue = 23.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Guy Pearce, Robert Carlyle, David Arquette, Jeremy Davies 
budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Antonia Bird 
average note = 6.8 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production countrie = Czech Republic 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
tagline = You Are Who You Eat 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! according to the description, the producer of the movie "ravenous" is indeed adam fields.']
fact : Producer = Adam Fields 

In the movie "Ravenous," directed by Antonia Bird and released on the 16th of March 1999, Captain John Boyd is tasked with investigating reports of missing persons at Fort Spencer, a remote Army outpost on the Western frontier. Upon arrival, Boyd and his regiment encounter a wounded frontiersman who reveals a chilling story of a wagon train massacre orchestrated by a rogue U.S. Army colonel. Fearing the worst, the regiment embarks on a treacherous journey into the wilderness to verify the gruesome claims. Starring Guy Pearce, Robert Carlyle, David Arquette, and Jeremy Davies, this English-language film produced by Adam Fields unfolds in the Czech Republic, with a budget of 12.0 million dollars and a revenue of 23.2 million dollars. With an average rating of 6.8, the movie's tagline "You Are Who You Eat" sets the tone for a gripping tale of survival and betrayal, lasting 1 hour and 40 minutes under the production company Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation.
